articles.name: Release Notes 2021-03-21, Web 5.3 (Logging in with a phone number)
articles.title: Release Notes 2021-03-21, Web 5.3 (Logging in with a phone number)
articles.body:
Hello there! Here's what new this month in TaxCaddy.

Logging in with a phone number

Users without an existing TaxCaddy account can now log in using a temporary password sent to their mobile phone after they click the link sent to their email address.

Click here to learn more about logging in with a phone number.

Users will receive a verification code text on their phone that they can enter in the text box. After reading and acknowledging the terms of service, select the check box then click Verify to log in.

Click here to learn more about logging in with a phone number.

After entering the verification code, users will see their documents/task appear in the Task List (left panel). Users without an account setup can return back to the log in page using the link in their email.

articles.name: Release Notes 2021-01-29, iOS 5.0 (Overview)
articles.title: Release Notes 2021-01-29, iOS 5.0 (Overview)
articles.body:
Hi! Here's what's new in TaxCaddy on iOS!

Overview Redesign

We completely redesigned the Overview screen from the ground up and made some major improvements along the way. When you log in you will see a completely new Overview screen.

Click here to take a full tour of the Overview screen in detail.

Notifications

The Announcement panel is now a Notifications icon. You can tap the Notification icon to see announcements and tips. The red badge icon indicates new announcements.

Quick Access Options

The Quick Access Options appears on top, you can swipe left/right to see all panel. You can add your financial institution via Smart Links, view tax payments that are due, and view your tax return summary when your tax professional prepares your return. You can also tap each panel to perform the action or view additional details pertaining to that panel.

Task List

Requests from your tax professional will appear in the task list. You can click each task to view the appropriate screen and complete that task.

Click here to take a full tour of the Overview screen in detail.

articles.name: Scheduled maintenance - 01/16/2021 11:00 PM PT - 01/17/2021 1:00 AM PT
articles.title: Scheduled maintenance - 01/16/2021 11:00 PM PT - 01/17/2021 1:00 AM PT
articles.body:
Announcement: We will be performing a two hour scheduled maintenance for TaxCaddy starting on Saturday 01/16/2021 at 11:00 PM PT and ending on 01/17/2021 at 1:00 AM PT. During this two-hour maintenance window, TaxCaddy will be inaccessible. All operations will resume immediately after the maintenance window.

From: Saturday 01/16/2021 at 11:00 PM PT

To: Sunday 01/17/2021 1:00 AM PT

Users will be unable to connect with TaxCaddy during the 2 hour maintenance period. We schedule maintenance at times that minimize the impact to our users but we apologize for any inconvenience.

articles.name: Release Notes 2020-12-21, iOS 4.12 (Personal Information, Questionnaire)
articles.title: Release Notes 2020-12-21, iOS 4.12 (Personal Information, Questionnaire)
articles.body:
Hi! Here's what's new in TaxCaddy on iOS!

  • Personal Information
  • Updated Questionnaire

Personal Information

TaxCaddy now gives you a convenient way to provide personal information to your tax professional. When requested, you can either take a photo or manually enter your Driver's License/State ID along with the mailing address. You can also provide your spouse's information if applicable.

Click here to learn more about providing personal information.

Updated Questionnaire

We made the questionnaire less time-consuming and easier to answer by grouping questions based on life-changing events. When answering the questionnaire, you will see fewer questions. You can help your tax professional get you the best tax return possible by selecting all the life-changing events that applied to you over the tax year. Your tax professional will then ask you questions based on the life-changing events you selected.

Click here to learn more about filling out the questionnaire.

You may not see all of the listed life-changing events on your screen.

articles.name: Confirming personal information
articles.title: Confirming personal information
articles.body:
Gathering personal information helps your tax professional prepare your tax return(s). The Personal Information screen in TaxCaddy allows you to conveniently share your personal information without having to fill out paperwork then sending it back to your tax professional.

Web

iOS

Android

TaxCaddy.com on PC, Mac, or tablet

Table of Contents:

  1. Step 1. Go to the Personal Information screen
  2. Step 2. Enter state ID
    • Add Manually
    • Upload Photo
  3. Step 3. Enter spouse state ID
  4. Step 4. Enter Mailing Address
  5. Step 5. Confirmation
  6. Edit or Clear Data

Step 1. Go to the Personal Information screen

Follow these steps to confirm your personal information when using TaxCaddy.com on your PC, Mac, or tablet.

Sign in to TaxCaddy.com

On the Task List (left panel), click Confirm Personal Information.

Step 2. Enter state ID

On the State ID panel, enter personal information for the main taxpayer user.

Click one of the following options:

I don't have an ID Click this if you do not have an identification card then skip to the next panel.
ADD Click ADD to add your Driver's License or State ID.

If you opted to add an ID then select one of the following options, then click CONTINUE.

  • Select Add Manually to manually enter information from your Driver's License or State ID.
  • Select Upload Photo to upload a picture of your Driver's License or State ID.

Add Manually

If you selected Add Manually then you will see the Add State ID dialog box.

To identify your ID type, select Driver's License or State ID.

Enter information from your ID card, then click SAVE.

Tip: You can click the Date Picker icon to select the date.

You can also click the calendar title to quickly switch between months and tax years.

The information you entered provided will appear in the panel. Go to the next panel.

Upload Photo

If you prefer to upload a photo, select Upload Photo, then click CONTINUE.

Select a photo of your diver's license, then click Open.

If necessary, you can adjust the uploaded photo by using the zoom and rotate feature. Click SAVE, to continue.

The uploaded photo will appear in the State ID panel.

Step 3. Enter spouse state ID

On the Spouse State ID panel, you can provide your spouse's ID if applicable. Click the following options:

I don't have a spouse

Click this if you do not have a spouse then skip to the next panel.

Note: This option will be disabled if you already have a spouse user connected to your account. LEARN MORE >>
My spouse does not have an ID Click this if your spouse does not have a Driver's License or a State ID. Once selected, skip to the next panel.
ADD Click ADD to add your spouse's Driver's License or State ID. You will need to either upload a photo or manually enter the information.

If you opted to add your spouse's ID then select one of the following options, then click CONTINUE.

  • Select Add Manually to manually enter information from your spouse's Driver's License or State ID. LEARN MORE >>
  • Select Upload Photo to upload a picture of your spouse's Driver's License or State ID. LEARN MORE >>

After confirming your spouse's information is correctly uploaded/entered, go to the next panel.

Step 4. Enter Mailing Address

On the Mailing Address panel, you can provide your mail/shipping address. Click the following options:

Use the same address as my state ID

Click this if your mailing address is the same address as your Driver's License or a State ID.

You don't need to manually enter or upload a photo of your mailing address if you selected this option.
ADD Click ADD to enter your mailing information or upload a photo of your address.

If you opted to add your mailing address then select one of the following options, then click CONTINUE.

  • Select Add Manually to manually enter your mailing address.
  • Select Upload Photo to upload a photo of your mailing address. You can upload a photo similar to previous steps. LEARN MORE >>

You will see the Add Mailing Address dialog box if you selected to manually enter your mailing address. Enter the mailing address, then click SAVE.

Step 5. Confirmation

Once you have submitted everything, click CONFIRM.

On the Personal Information Confirmation dialog box, click SUBMIT.

You cannot make any changes to your personal information once you click SUBMIT. If you need to remove or update any information, click CANCEL.

Click here to learn more about updating personal information before submitting.

Your personal information will be sent to your tax professional and the task will be removed from the Task List on the Overview screen.

You will be able to see a printed copy of your personal information after you complete the questionnaire and your tax professional prints the questionnaire to Documents > Uploaded Documents.

Click here to learn more about filling out a questionnaire.

Edit or Clear Data

Before submitting your personal information, you can go back and edit or remove data entered for each panel. Data cannot be edited or cleared if the personal information has already been submitted.

Click EDIT to edit the information on the selected panel.

Click CLEAR DATA to remove all information for the selected panel.

If you uploaded a photo of your ID then you can also click the x icon to remove an uploaded photo.

iOS mobile app

Follow these steps on your iOS mobile phone app:

Sign in to the TaxCaddy mobile app, then tap the Confirm Personal Information under Tax Pro Request.

State ID

On the State ID panel, tap one of the following options:

I don't have a State ID Tap this if you do not have an identification card then skip to the next panel.
ADD Tap ADD to add your Driver's License or State ID.

If you selected to add a State ID then you can:

  • Tap Add Manually to manually enter information from your Driver's License or State ID.
  • Tap Take a Photo to take a photo of your Driver's License or State ID.
  • Tap Upload a Photo to upload a picture of your Driver's License or State ID from your device.

(iOS) Add Manually

If you selected Add Manually then you will see the Add ID screen. Tap Driver's License or State ID, enter all the details from your ID, then tap SAVE CHANGES.

You will see an error message(s) if a required field is missing information. You can enter the missing information then tap SAVE CHANGES again.

(iOS) Take a Photo

If you selected Take a Photo then TaxCaddy may ask permission to access your camera. Tap SET PERMISSION.

Tap OK to continue.

Take a photo of your ID.

Tap Use Photo to use the photo. Tap Retake to take a picture again.

If necessary, you can adjust the uploaded photo by using the zoom and rotate feature.

Tap Save to upload the photo.

Tap NEXT to continue to the next panel.

Tap EDIT to change the provided ID.

Tap CLEAR DATA to remove the currently provided information for this panel.

Spouse State ID

On the Spouse State ID panel, you can provide your spouse's ID if applicable. Tap the following options:

I don't have a spouse

Tap this if you do not have a spouse, then tap NEXT to skip to the next panel.

Note: This option will be disabled if you already have a spouse user connected to your account.
My spouse does not have an ID Tap this if your spouse does not have a Driver's License or a State ID. Once selected, tap NEXT to skip to the next panel.
ADD Click ADD to add your spouse's Driver's License or State ID. You will need to either take a photo, upload a photo or manually enter the information.

After uploading/entering your spouse's personal information, tap NEXT.

Mailing Address

On the Mailing Address panel, you can provide your mail/shipping address. Click the following options:

USE ADDRESS FROM MY ID

Tap this if your mailing address is the same address as your Driver's License or a State ID.

You don't need to manually enter or upload a photo of your mailing address if you selected this option.
ADD Tap ADD to enter your mailing information or take/upload a photo of your address.

Tap CONTINUE to submit your personal information.

You cannot make any changes to your personal information once you click SUBMIT. If you need to remove or update any information, go to the previous panels then tap EDIT or CLEAR DATA.

Android mobile app

Follow these steps on your Android mobile phone app.

Sign in to the TaxCaddy mobile app, then tap the Confirm Personal Information under Tax Pro Request.

State ID

On the State ID panel, tap one of the following options:

I don't have a State ID Tap this if you do not have an identification card then skip to the next panel.
ADD Tap ADD to add your Driver's License or State ID.

If you selected to add a State ID then you can:

  • Tap Add Manually to manually enter information from your Driver's License or State ID.
  • Tap Take a Photo to take a photo of your Driver's License or State ID.
  • Tap Upload a Photo to upload a picture of your Driver's License or State ID from your device.

(Android) Add Manually

If you selected Add Manually then you will see the Add ID screen. Tap Driver's License or State ID, enter all the details from your ID, then tap SAVE CHANGES.

You will see an error message(s) if a required field is missing information. You can enter the missing information then tap SAVE CHANGES again.

(Android) Take a Photo

If you selected Take a Photo then TaxCaddy may ask permission to access your camera. Tap SET PERMISSION.

Tap Allow to continue.

Take a photo of your ID.

If necessary, you can adjust the uploaded photo by using the zoom and rotate feature.

Tap Save to upload the photo.

Tap NEXT to continue to the next panel.

Tap EDIT to change the provided ID.

Tap CLEAR DATA to remove the currently provided information for this panel.

Spouse State ID

On the Spouse State ID panel, you can provide your spouse's ID if applicable. Tap the following options:

I don't have a spouse

Tap this if you do not have a spouse, then tap NEXT to skip to the next panel.

Note: This option will be disabled if you already have a spouse user connected to your account.
My spouse does not have an ID Tap this if your spouse does not have a Driver's License or a State ID. Once selected, tap NEXT to skip to the next panel.
ADD Click ADD to add your spouse's Driver's License or State ID. You will need to either take a photo, upload a photo or manually enter the information.

After uploading/entering your spouse's personal information, tap NEXT.

Mailing Address

On the Mailing Address panel, you can provide your mail/shipping address. Click the following options:

USE ADDRESS FROM MY ID

Tap this if your mailing address is the same address as your Driver's License or a State ID.

You don't need to manually enter or upload a photo of your mailing address if you selected this option.
ADD Tap ADD to enter your mailing information or take/upload a photo of your address.

Tap CONFIRM to submit your personal information.

You cannot make any changes to your personal information once you click SUBMIT. If you need to remove or update any information, go to the previous panels then tap EDIT or CLEAR DATA.

articles.name: Release Notes 2020-11-03, Web 4.11 (Overview)
articles.title: Release Notes 2020-11-03, Web 4.11 (Overview)
articles.body:
Hello there! We are really excited to share today's new release with you so let's jump right in.

Overview Redesign

We completely redesigned the Overview screen from the ground up and made some major improvements along the way. When you log in you will see a completely new Overview screen.

Click here to take a full tour of the Overview screen in detail.

If this is your first time logging into the new view then you will see a modal showing you all the new enhancements. You can click through them to see what's new. You can also try out TaxCaddy in Dark Mode if you haven't already.

Task List

The left panel is a Task List. Each item in the task list is an action item requested by your tax professional. When your tax professional needs you to review, sign, or upload a specific document, you will see the task appear in the list. You can click each task to load the relevant screen that will help you complete that task.

Click here to learn more about the task list on the Overview screen.

Quick Access Options

Each panel lets you quickly perform an action. You can upload tax documents, add your first financial institution via Smart Links, view tax payments that are due, and view your tax return summary when your tax professional prepares your return. You can click each panel to perform the action or view additional details.

Click here to learn more about Quick Access Options on the Overview screen.

On the two Upload Tax Documents panel, you can click or drag & drop documents to quickly upload documents pertaining to that tax year.

Notifications

The Announcement panel is now a Notifications panel. You can click the Notification icon to see announcements and tips. The red badge icon indicates new announcements.

Feeling nostalgic about the Legacy view? No worries. We have you covered. Scroll down then click Switch Back to Legacy View on the lower right side.

articles.body:
Hi! Here's what's new in TaxCaddy on Android!

Tax payments: Track Payments

For tax payments paid by check, if you choose to mail tax payments via Certified Mail then you will now see a new option that navigates you directly to the tracking page.

Click here to learn more about tracking tax payment shipping.

Click here to learn more about paying tax payment by check.

On the Tax Payments screen, click the Menu icon then click Track Payment. TaxCaddy will navigate you directly to the tracking page where you can see your mailing status.

The Track Payment option only appears if you mailed a tax payment check by mail through TaxCaddy using Certified Mail.

Messages

Now in messages, it's easier to identify new unread messages from your tax professional. You will see a divider between old and new messages.

Click here to learn more about messages.

articles.name: Dark Mode
articles.title: Dark Mode
articles.body:
In Dark Mode, TaxCaddy uses a darker color palette for all screens, views, menus, and controls. You will also see a more vibrant foreground content stand out against the darker backgrounds. Dark mode reduces the luminance emitted by device screens, while still meeting minimum color contrast ratios. TaxCaddy Dark Mode also improves visual ergonomics by reducing eye strain, adjusting brightness to current lighting conditions, and facilitating screen use in dark environments.

Web

iOS

Android

TaxCaddy.com on PC, Mac or tablet

Follow these steps to enable Dark Mode:

  1. Log in to TaxCaddy.com.

  2. On the upper right, click the User Menu then click Settings.

  3. On the Settings tab, click Accessibility.

  4. Click On to enable the Dark Mode. Click Off to disable the Dark Mode.

  5. Once enabled, Dark Mode will appear on all pages. 

    Dark Mode color theme may vary based on the tax professional you are connected to.

iOS mobile app

Follow these steps on your iOS mobile phone app:

Android mobile app

Follow these steps on your Android mobile phone app.

articles.name: Generating HAR file
articles.title: Generating HAR file
articles.body:
If you are having any issues with TaxCaddy then please contact TaxCaddy Support team first. You only need to generate the HAR file if it is specifically requested by the TaxCaddy Support team.

Click here to learn more about contacting TaxCaddy Support.

Generating a HAR log file creates a network activity log that TaxCaddy Support team can use to troubleshoot difficult issues. You may be requested to record your network activity log while the issue is occurring. Once you reproduced the issue, provide the HAR file to TaxCaddy Support Team for further analysis.

You can create HAR report for the following browsers:

  • Chrome
  • Edge
  • Firefox
  • Safari

Chrome

  1. Open Google Chrome and go to the page where the issue is occurring.

  2. From the Chrome menu bar () select More Tools > Developer Tools.

  3. From the panel opened, select Network.

  4. Look for a round Record () icon in the upper left corner of the tab and make sure it is red. If it is grey, click it once to start recording.

  5. Click the Clear () icon to clear out any existing logs from the Network.

  6. Reproduce the issue that you were experiencing before, while the network requests are being recorded.

    Once you have reproduced the issue, click the Export icon.

  7. Upload your HAR file to your ticket or attach it to your email so that our Support team can analyze it.

Edge

Internet explorer is not supported by TaxCaddy. Please install Microsoft Edge or any of the other supported browsers.

Click here to learn more about TaxCaddy browser support.

  1. Open Edge and go to the page where the issue is occurring.

  2. From the Edge menu bar select View > Developer > Developer Tools. Alternatively, you can press F12 on your keyboard.

  3. From the panel opened, select the Network.

  4. Look for a round Record () icon in the upper left corner of the tab, and make sure it is red. If it is grey, click it once to start recording.

  5. Click the Clear () icon to clear out any existing logs from the Network tab.

  6. Reproduce the issue that you were experiencing before, while the network requests are being recorded.

    Once you have reproduced the issue, click the Export icon.

  7. Upload your HAR file to your ticket or attach it to your email so that our Support team can analyze it.

Firefox

  1. Open Firefox and go to the page where you are experiencing trouble.

  2. Select the Firefox menu (three horizontal parallel lines) at the top-right of your browser window, then select Web Developer> Network.

  3. The Developer Network Tools opens as a docked panel at the side or bottom of Firefox. Click the Network tab.

  4. The recording auto-starts when you start performing actions in the browser.

    Click the Clear () icon to clear out any existing logs from the Network.

  5. Once you have reproduced the issue and you see that all of the actions have been generated in the Developer Network Panel (should just take a few seconds), click the settings () icon, then click Save all as HAR.

  6. Save the HAR file to your device.

  7. Upload your HAR file to your ticket so that we may analyze it.

Safari

  1. Go to Safari > Preferences, click Advanced, then select Show Develop menu in menu bar.
  2. Open the Develop menu, select Show Web Inspector.
  3. Click the Network tab, reproduced the issue.
  4. Click the Export icon on the far right of the Network tab and save the HAR file.
  5. Send us the file via your support ticket.

Tax payments paid by check Status

Tax payment vouchers that were paid by check (using TaxCaddy) will now show the document menu status as Payment Sent.

Click here to learn more about paying tax payments by check.

The Payment Summary screen will also update the status to Payment Sent.

Next, click Allow to receive notifications.

articles.name: Release Notes 2020-06-18, iOS 4.04 (Pay by Check)
articles.title: Release Notes 2020-06-18, iOS 4.04 (Pay by Check)
articles.body:
Hi there! Here's what's new in TaxCaddy on iOS.

Pay by Check

We introduced a new feature that allows you to pay your Federal and State tax payments by check. You can use TaxCaddy to send physical checks to the proper taxing authority. You will now see an option to pay by check if the tax payment has been cleared for official use with the taxing authority by your tax professional.

Click here to learn more about paying tax payments by check.

Shipping Discount!

TaxCaddy is offering a promotional discount on shipping! For a limited time, the cost of USPS Certified Mail has been reduced to $9.95 (normally priced at $14.95). Take advantage of this offer to get proof of delivery through electronic tracking numbers when using USPS Certified Mail.

Once you add or verify the required information, you can review your paper check then send it to the proper taxing authority.

On the document menu, you will see the Track Payment option appear in 1 business day if you chose to mail your tax payments via Certified Mail. The Track Payment option allows you lookup tracking information to see the current status of your delivery.

Click here to learn more about tracking tax payment shipping.

articles.name: 2020-06-15 Tax Payment due dates updated
articles.title: 2020-06-15 Tax Payment due dates updated
articles.body:
Due to the unprecedented COVID-19 crisis, certain tax payment due dates have been extended by federal and state governments to allow people more time to pay their 2019 balance due and 2020 estimated personal income taxes. To accommodate for this, we updated the due dates for many existing tax payments in TaxCaddy on April 14th, 2020. Since that time, many taxing authorities have passed additional extensions, especially on quarter 2 estimated voucher payments. In response, we have mirrored their updates for many existing tax payments in TaxCaddy, if applicable.

Click here to learn more about tax payment vouchers.

Some tax payment due dates may not have been updated due to special cases.  If you have any questions about your tax payment due dates, you can message your tax professional for clarification.

Click here to learn more about messaging your tax professional about your tax payments voucher.

articles.name: Message for TaxCaddy customers regarding COVID-19
articles.title: Message for TaxCaddy customers regarding COVID-19
articles.body:
Dear TaxCaddy Customers,

We hope you and your families are staying safe and healthy during this unprecedented COVID-19 crisis.

Beginning in early March, we took proactive steps to protect the health of employees, customers, and visitors, and to ensure the continuity of business operations in the event of a worsening public health environment. While the State of California is under a Stay At Home Order, the business is fully functioning and we continue to provide customer support without delay or interruption.

The health and safety of our employees and customers continues to be our top priority. So, please stay safe and stay at home. Protect your families, the vulnerable, and our devoted healthcare workers.

We are extremely appreciative of your understanding and support while we all rally to fight this crisis. We look forward to getting back to normal soon. Until then, be well and stay safe.

Regards,

The TaxCaddy Team

articles.title: Release Notes 2020-02-17, Web 4.01.4 (Document Viewer)
articles.body:
Here's what's new in TaxCaddy.

Document Viewer updated

We released a hotfix to address issues some users were experiencing. The Document Viewer has been updated to addresses the following issues and includes the following changes:

  • Radio options on fillable forms were appearing blank on subsequent visits. The selected options will now be visible on subsequent visits.
  • Entering commas or other disallowed validated special characters were appearing as 0.
  • Certain documents were appearing blank in Firefox, this issue has also been resolved.

The Document Viewer user interface has also been updated for improved user experience.

Click here to follow the open issues article for current open issues.

Click here to follow the resolved issues article to view issues that have been resolved.

Header

The header shows the document name, uploaded date, and the document uploader. You can click the link on the left to go back to the previous page. Fillable Form icon indicates that the current document has fillable form fields that can be filled out.

When viewing certain documents (i.e. uploaded documents, invoices, tax returns, etc.) you can use the drop down menu on the right to toggle between different documents without going back to the previous screen.

Side Panel

The side panel helps you navigate a multi-page document by viewing bookmarks, thumbnails, and annotations placed on the document. You can also use the search feature to find keywords or phrases.

Footer

The footer allows you to download documents and perform applicable actions on the document (i.e. Sign, Review, Pay, etc.). You can also view the current document status next to the Download button.

You may see the following icons on the footer:

Icons Descriptions
Downloads the document
Moves the document to another category
Deletes the document
Pay invoice or mark tax payment voucher as paid.

articles.name: About TaxCaddy
articles.title: About TaxCaddy
articles.body:
TaxCaddy streamlines the tax return preparation process for you and your tax professional by helping you gather and share files and provide all the information that's needed to prepare your tax return. The following is a summary of many of the great features that TaxCaddy has to offer.

Go to TaxCaddy.com to learn more

TaxCaddy is not your accounting firm's portal. Your TaxCaddy account is yours to keep, forever. You decide who to share your information with. If you change accounting firms, you take your TaxCaddy account with you.

Gather documents

Upload Documents

Browse your PC, Mac, tablet, or mobile phone and upload PDF files, Excel spreadsheets, Word documents, and more.

Smart Links

You can also let TaxCaddy retrieve your 1099s, 1098s, and W-2s automatically through our Smart Links technology.

Take a photo

You can also use the TaxCaddy mobile app to photograph and upload documents as you receive them. Categorize them on the spot then shred the paper.

Electronic Signatures

Sign anything, anywhere

From your PC, Mac, tablet or mobile phone electronically sign engagement letters, consent requests, e-file authorizations, and other documents. 100% IRS compliant.

Get spouse signature

Your spouse can sign documents using your TaxCaddy account or by creating their own account.

Tax Returns and Payments

Tax Returns

You can view, approve and store your tax return right in TaxCaddy.

Estimated Tax Payments

Your tax professional can create tax payment vouchers that help you keep track of your estimated tax payments. You can also mail your tax payments by mail using TaxCaddy.

Notify your tax professional

Message your tax professional

Have a question about something? Send your tax professional a message directly from TaxCaddy.

Done Uploading

With a simple click of a button, you can inform your tax professional that you are done uploading your tax documents.

Invoices

Pay Invoices

You can pay your tax professional for their services directly from your couch using your credit card, bank account, Google Pay, or Apple Pay.

articles.name: [INTERNAL] Support Request Problems & Incidents
articles.title: [INTERNAL] Support Request Problems & Incidents
articles.body:
When a support request in the TC support center presents itself to be a potential bug and is affecting multiple users, we follow the process below.

Processing a Problem Ticket

  1. Identify a potential bug. If the solution to a request that a taxpayer sends us is not easily resolved by one of our general resolutions and/or the solution to the request is not documented in our help center as a result of an update from our developers, suspect the issue as a bug.

  2. Attempt to reproduce the issue. If necessary, get more information from the reporting-user, but try to reproduce the issue to make finding a solution easier for our support team or our developers.

  3. Document the issue in Zendesk as a Problem.
    a. Create a new ticket for the Problem.
    b. Summarize the identified Problem in the Subject line of the ticket and include "Problem Ticket - " at the beginning of that line.
    c. Thoroughly describe the Problem in the comment box, including all of the work you did to verify the potential bug.
    d. Mark yourself as the requester, mark Anthony as the assignee, and fill out the remaining ticket fields as normal.
    e. Be sure to fill out the Type-ticket field as "Problem;" this will turn the ticket into a Problem ticket and allow other tickets to be linked to it as Incidents.
    f. When it has been created, update the JIRA ID-ticket field to the issue that was created in JIRA.
    • We create a new ticket for the Problem instead using an existing ticket that was submitted by the user(s) because a workaround solution may be made available for the user(s) before an actual solution is found. With that in mind, Incidents of the Problem can be marked as solved while the Problem ticket remains open to allow our team to continue to looking for a solution to the actual Problem.



  4. Document the issue in JIRA within the TCSUP project.
    a. Create a new issue in JIRA.
    b. Ensure that the Project is "TC_Support (TCSUP)" and the Issue Type is "Support Application Defect" not "Bug." This is at the request of the developers.
    c. Summarize the identified Problem in the Summary line of the issue.
    d. Thoroughly describe the Problem in the Description box, including all of the work you did to verify the potential bug.
    e. Include a link to the Zendesk Problem ticket in the Description box.
    f. Select the Create button at the bottom of the form. You do not need to fill out the remaining fields.

Processing an Incident Ticket

  1. Identify an Incident of the Problem ticket. Compare the issue to the existing Problem ticket. Gather information and/or screenshots from the taxpayer to verify they are the same problem.

  2. Update the Type-ticket field as "Incident." An additional ticket field should appear titled Linked problem. Select the existing Problem ticket as the linked problem.
  3. If they were not filled out already, fill out the remaining ticket fields as normal.

articles.name: [INTERNAL] The TaxCaddy Support Tool & Me
articles.title: [INTERNAL] The TaxCaddy Support Tool & Me
articles.body:
[Article applicable as of Feb 21, 2019]

In its current state, the TaxCaddy Support Tool requires a degree of experience in order to use it to its fullest potential. This article serves to catch-up new users to the tool to make it fully usable as soon as possible.

Basic Usage

Home Page

Look up existing & invited user records from the Home page. Use the Taxpayer Email, Taxpayer Firstname, or Taxpayer Lastname fields to find possible records for your search. Specify a TaxYear to find a single record.

When a single record is displayed in the results table, additional information becomes available. (The additional menu will appear for all single record results, but only records for invited accounts can yield data in the additional menu).

Important notes about the additional information menu:

  • Last Success login of selected user indicates that a user successfully provided their email and password, however, it does not indicate if a user successfully passed their Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) prompt, i.e. if the user successfully accessed their TaxCaddy account.
  • The User Info drop-down can only provide data for the Registered Details option.
  • The Smart Links option can only provide data for the most recently added Smart Link.
    • The following help center article assists in reading the Smart Links table: [INTERNAL] Support Tool Smart Links Definitions.
  • If any of the remaining options return no record, action has yet to be taken for that specific option.
  • TaxCaddy accounts with Outside Enrolled status - Status seen in the results table - will not provide data in the additional information menu, except in the case of the Smart Links option.
  • Times captured within the support tool are in the GMT-timezone.

Reset Password Page

Resend the password reset link to the email address of an existing TaxCaddy account. Use the Email field to designate the account that needs a password reset and the Comment/Support Case ID field to include a link to the taxpayer support ticket.

Two Factor Page

Enable/Disable 2FA for an existing TaxCaddy account and unlock a locked TaxCaddy account with the Two Factor page. Use the Email field to designate the account that needs a 2FA enable/disable or account unlock and the Comment field to include a link to the taxpayer support ticket.

Important notes about the Two Factor page:

  • The Email radio button for the 2FA setting can send an email with a 2FA code, but will automatically prompt a phone number to be entered as the new 2FA option. This was due to SurePrep's migration away from email-message 2FA to text-message 2FA: Migrating to text message two-factor authentication.
  • The Unlock User feature can also be used to re-enable a Password Reset Disabled account.
    • In the Support Tool alone, there is no indication that an account is Password Reset Disabled, you can verify that status by checking SparkPost.

Special Usage

  • When viewing the Invite/Reminder option of the additional information menu, the presence of more than one invite or reminder request will indicate that the user has been added to (and removed from) a tax firm's client management screen on more than one occasion. We know this because a firm can only send a single invite/reminder per client management record.
    • The most common requests that use this tip are missing or duplicate questionnaire requests.
  • When searching for a TaxCaddy account that appears to have no record in our system, it is sometimes beneficial to search with a nonsensical tax year (e.g. 1, 45, 05) or a tax year that the TaxCaddy account has no instance for (e.g. 2009 or 2020 where the TaxCaddy account only has instances for 2016-18). Searching in this way yields results independent of a tax year-connected record.
    • The most common requests that use this tip deal with...
      • previously deleted accounts
      • CPA type accounts
      • Enrolled TaxCaddy accounts that appear to have no UserId
  • When searching for spouse accounts in the support tool, you can identify them by their OutSide Enrolled status. Keep in mind, actually outside enrolled accounts use the same status. You must verify an account's spouse status with the process in the following help center article: [INTERNAL] Verifying a Spouse Account.

articles.name: [INTERNAL] Verifying a Spouse Account
articles.title: [INTERNAL] Verifying a Spouse Account
articles.body:
Because of the currently vague nature of spouse accounts, there is no obvious way to tell if an account is a spouse account. In the TaxCaddy support tool, spouse accounts can be identified with the status "OutsideEnrolled." However, actual Outside Enrolled accounts show the same status, so that status is not a good indicator for identifying a spouse account.

To verify a spouse account, we use the following method:

1. Login to Administrative TaxCaddy at https://production.sureprep.com/Home/Login.

2. Add a new user/client using the potential spouse account's email. The other information does not matter, but required fields need to be provided.

3a. If the error "An account already exists in TaxCaddy with this email address" appears, then the account associated with that email is a spouse account.

3b. If the account associated with that email is not a spouse account, one of the following two things will happen:

  • The error "Email already exists. Please use a different email address." will appear to indicate that a main account is associated with that email exists in that firm's records.
  • The record will be successfully created to indicate that a main account is associated with that email in another firm's Administrative TaxCaddy menu or that email is Outside Enrolled.

articles.name: [INTERNAL] Zendesk Administrative Updates
articles.title: [INTERNAL] Zendesk Administrative Updates
articles.body:
When notable administrative changes have been made to the TaxCaddy Zendesk, those changes should be updated on this article for record-keeping purposes.

Mar 5, 2019 Update

To improve the accuracy of the Search-feature in this help center, the top search strings that yielded no results have been added as labels to their relevant help center articles.

  • The following search strings were added to the Viewing Requested Items and Uploading Requested Items help center articles:
    • Charitable
    • Charity
    • Contribution
    • Schedule C
    • Donations
    • W2
    • Tax
    • Taxes
  • The misspelling "questionaire" has been added as a label to the Filling Out The Questionnaire and Messaging About the Questionnaire help center articles.
  • "Delete account" and "deleting account" have been added as labels to both Getting Help help center articles.
  • "Joint return" has been added as a label to the Adding and Removing Spouse Or Additional User Accounts and Sharing Your Account Access With Others help center articles.
