articles.name: SafeSend Returns integration with TaxCaddy
articles.title: SafeSend Returns integration with TaxCaddy
articles.body:
Your tax professional can use SafeSend Returns to send you your tax return for review and e-file authorization for your signature. Once everything is reviewed and signed the documents can be automatically stored in TaxCaddy.

TaxCaddy.com on PC, Mac or tablet

Follow these steps to use SafeSend Returns with TaxCaddy:

  1. Open the email with the subject line "Please review your tax return and sign your e-file forms", then click the link provided in the email.

  2. To log in you must first authenticate yourself by providing the last four digits of your social security number, then click Authenticate to Continue.

    Note: 
	The Authenticate to Continue button will be disabled until you enter the last four digits of your SSN.

  3. Access Code Required dialog box will appear and an email with the access code will be sent to your email address.

  4. Copy the access code sent to your email.

  5. Paste the access code in Access Code Required dialog box, then click Continue.

  6. Once you have successfully signed in, click Let's Get Started.

  7. On the left panel, you can view information about your documents automatically downloading to TaxCaddy. Additionally, you can also download your documents locally at the end of e-sign process.

  8. Click Continue to begin e-sign process.

  9. Verify your date of birth, select the I have reviewed my tax return and consent to e-sign check box, then click Continue.

  10. Once the documents load, click the Start tag on top. The tag will move to where you need to sign the document.

  11. When you see the Next tag, click the Click here to sign link next to it.

  12. When the e-sign dialog box appears, enter your name if it's not already there. You will see your signature appear on the bottom. If you are satisfied with the result, click Apply to place your signature.

    Alternatively, you can also draw your signature. Click the Draw tab to draw your signature in the Draw Your Signature box.

  13. Click Next to go to the next signature location. Click the signature preview on each location to place the signature.

  14. You will see the Finished tag once you finish signing the document, click Continue to proceed forward.

  15. When the Signing Complete dialog box appears, click Continue.

  16. Once completed, you will be taken to the tax payments voucher screen. You have the option to pay these tax payment vouchers as you normally would (Mailing a check, etc.). You can even set email reminders so you don't forget your due date.

    Note: 
	These vouchers will also be uploaded to TaxCaddy

    Once you're finished, click Done.

  17. You will see a confirmation message on a new screen. All your documents will be downloaded in your TaxCaddy account.

    If you want to download your tax documents locally, click Download Tax Documents.


    Sign in to TaxCaddy, select the tax year to view all your Uploaded Documents, Tax Returns, and Tax Payment Vouchers.

articles.name: Viewing Invoices
articles.title: Viewing Invoices
articles.body:
Your Tax Professional can charge you for their services by creating invoices. These invoices can be viewed, paid, and downloaded.

Web

iOS

Android

TaxCaddy.com on PC, Mac, or tablet

  1. Sign in to TaxCaddy.com

  2. Click Invoices.

  3. Select the applicable Tax Year.

    Invoices are only visible under the tax year they were created in by your tax professional. Your Tax Professional can place invoices due from a different tax year in under the selected tax year. For example, your Tax Professional can make an invoice due the previous year under the current year.

  4. The list of invoices created by your tax professional will appear. Click on an invoice to view it.

    The invoice will open in the Document Viewer window.

You can also use the search bar on top to search for an invoice.

iOS mobile app

Follow these steps to view your tax payment voucher on your iOS mobile phone app.

  1. Log in to the TaxCaddy mobile app.
  2. Tap More on the navigation tab bar then tap Invoice.

  3. Tap the Tax Year on the top left, when the left panel appears, then tap the applicable Tax Year.
    Invoices are only visible under the tax year they were created in by your tax professional. Your Tax Professional can place invoices due from a different tax year in a selected tax year. For example, your Tax Professional can make an invoice due the previous year under the current year.


  4. The list of invoices created by your tax professional will appear for the selected tax year.



    Invoices can appear inside three sections:
    • Invoice Due
    • Paid Invoices
    • Refunded
    • In Process
    You can only pay invoices under the Invoice Due section.

    Indicates the invoices is past due.
    Indicates the invoice has been Paid.
  5. Tap an Invoice to view it in the PDF Viewer.

  6. If the document opens the Payment Summary screen, click View Invoice.



    You will see the Invoice opens in the PDF Viewer screen

  7. Alternatively, you can tap the Menu icon on the invoice you want to pay.



    When the dialog box appears, tap View Invoice.

  8. You can also search for invoices from the Overview, Documents, Messages, Tax Returns, and Invoices screen.

Android mobile app

Follow these steps to pay invoices on your Android mobile phone app.

  1. Log in to the TaxCaddy mobile app.
  2. Tap the Menu icon

  3. Tap Invoices

  4. On the Invoices screen, tap the Tax Year icon to select the applicable Tax Year.
    Invoices are only visible under the tax year they were created in by your tax professional. Your Tax Professional can place invoices due from a different tax year in a selected tax year. For example, your Tax Professional can make an invoice due the previous year under the current year.



    Swipe up or down to select the applicable tax year then tap SELECT.

  5. The list of invoices created by your tax professional will appear for the selected tax year.



    Invoices can appear inside three sections:
    • Invoice Due
    • Paid Invoices
    • Refunded
    • In Process
    You can only pay invoices under the Invoice Due section.

    Indicates the invoices is past due.

    Indicates the invoice has been Paid.

  6. Tap an Invoice to view it in the PDF Viewer.

  7. If the document opens the Payment Summary screen, tap View Invoice.

  8. The invoice will open in the PDF Viewer screen

  9. Alternatively, you can tap the Menu icon on the invoice you want to pay.



    When the dialog box appears, tap Pay Now.

  10. You can also search for invoices from the Overview, Documents, Messages, Tax Returns, and Invoices screen.

articles.name: [INTERNAL] Adding Firms/Domains to the "Sponsoring CPA" Pick List
articles.title: [INTERNAL] Adding Firms/Domains to the "Sponsoring CPA" Pick List
articles.body:
From the left menu: Settings Icon>User Fields>Sponsoring CPA

Select Ctrl+F to verify that the firm you're adding is not already listed.

Add the new firm by scrolling to the bottom of the list and selecting the Plus Icon.

A new field to add the Title and Tag will appear.

Enter the firm name in the Title field. Enter the tag for the firm in the Tag field.

The naming convention, sponsoring_cpa_firm_ must preface the firm name in the Tag field.

Special characters, commas, and periods are not recognized in the Tag field. Only numbers and letters are recognized. You may replace "&" with "and". Remove any commas and periods in the tag field.

After you have input the correct information in the Title and Tag fields, ensure that a check-mark is placed in the Sort Field Options alphabetically on save option.

Select Update Field to add the new entry.

If multiple entries are required, update the list after each individual entry. Updating multiple entries at once (batching) may result in delays if there is an input error in any of the new entries, as the system will not specify the error location.

articles.name: Viewing a tax payment voucher
articles.title: Viewing a tax payment voucher
articles.body:
Tax payment vouchers help you keep track of the tax payments that are due. When your tax professional is done preparing your tax payment voucher, they will upload it to the Tax Payments section. Additionally, you can also use TaxCaddy to pay your Federal and State tax payments by check. When you make a payment through TaxCaddy, a paper check will be mailed to the proper taxing authority.

Click here to learn more about marking tax payment voucher as paid.

Click here to learn more about paying tax payments by check.

Web

iOS

Android

TaxCaddy.com on PC, Mac or tablet

Follow these steps to view your tax payment voucher when using TaxCaddy.com on your PC, Mac, or tablet.

  1. Sign in to TaxCaddy.com

  2. Click Tax Payments.

  3. Select the tax year. Tax payment vouchers are only visible under the tax year they were created in by your tax professional. If the voucher is past due from the previous year, it can still be placed under the current year by your tax professional.

  4. List of tax payment vouchers created by your tax professional will appear on the screen. Click the voucher to view the tax payment document.

    You can also open the tax payment voucher document from the document's tile menu. Click the Menu icon, when the options appear, click View.

    On the Overview screen, you can click the View Upcoming Tax Payments Due tile to directly view the document for an upcoming tax payment voucher.

    If you are using the old legacy view of TaxCaddy then you can click Tax Payments on the side panel, then click the voucher name.

Tax Payment Status

The Status column on tax payment vouchers allows you and your tax professional to track your tax payment status.

Status Description
Unpaid

Tax payment has not been paid (Marked as Paid/Pay by Check).
Past Due

Tax payment has not been paid and is now passed the due date.

If you already made the tax payment then mark the tax payment voucher as paid.
Paid

Tax payment voucher has been marked as paid by you or your tax professional. You can inform your tax professional that you made the tax payment by marking the tax payment as paid.

Click here to learn more about marking tax payment voucher as paid.
Payment Sent

Tax payment check has been mailed to the taxing authority using the Pay by Check feature.

Click here to learn more about paying tax payments by check.

iOS mobile app

Follow these steps to view your tax payment voucher on your iOS mobile phone app.

  1. Log in to the TaxCaddy mobile app.

  2. Tap More on the navigation tab then tap Tax Payments.

  3. List of tax payment vouchers created by your tax professional will appear. Tap on the tax payment voucher you want to view.

    Status Icon Description
    Tax payment voucher has been marked as paid or paid by check.
    Tax payment has not been paid (Marked as Paid/Pay by Check) and is now passed the due date.
    [No icon] Tax payment has not been paid.

  4. You can also view the tax payment voucher by using the Menu icon on the right side of the voucher. Tap the Menu button, then tap View Voucher.

  5. The tax payment voucher will open in the viewer.

Android mobile app

Follow these steps to view your tax payment voucher on your Android mobile phone app.

  1. Log in to the TaxCaddy mobile app.

  2. Tap the Menu icon

  3. Tap Tax Payments.

  4. A list of tax payment vouchers created by your tax professional will appear. Tap the tax payment voucher you want to view.

    Status Icon Description
    Tax payment voucher has been marked as paid or paid by check.
    Tax payment has not been paid (Marked as Paid/Pay by Check) and is now passed the due date.
    [No icon] Tax payment has not been paid.

  5. You can also tap the Menu icon, then click View.

  6. The tax payment voucher will open in the viewer.

articles.name: Downloading multiple documents at once
articles.title: Downloading multiple documents at once
articles.body:
Follow these steps to download multiple documents at once.

  1. Log in to TaxCaddy.com, click Documents, then click Uploaded Documents.

  2. Click the Tax Year menu to select the relevant tax year.

  3. Select the check box next to the documents you want to download.

  4. To select all documents in a category, click the checkbox at the top of that category.

  5. To select all documents, click the checkbox next to Select All at the top.

  6. The total file size will be displayed at the top. You can only download 1 GB of files at a time. If there are more than 1 GB of files in your account, you'll need to download in multiple selections. Click Download to begin your download.

  7. The files will download in a .zip file.

articles.name: Updating your Safe Senders list in Verizon
articles.title: Updating your Safe Senders list in Verizon
articles.body:
To make sure you receive emails from TaxCaddy, you should add taxcaddy.com to your list of safe senders. "Whitelist" noreply@taxcaddy.com or the entire taxcaddy.com domain name to make sure our emails go to your inbox. If you have trouble receiving emails from TaxCaddy after following these instructions, contact support.

Whitelist an Email Sender in Verizon

The Block Senders E-mail Option page is used to maintain the Block Senders List. You can add e-mail addresses and domains to the Block Sender List, remove e-mail addresses and domains from the Block Sender List, and add e-mail addresses or sub-domains to the Safe List.

  • Enter e-mail addresses (ex: noreply@taxcaddy.com) or sub-domains in the Safe List field
  • Click Add to allow all e-mail messages from these senders to reach your inbox. Note: Entries in this list take precedence over all other Block Sender List entries. An e-mail sent from someone in a blocked domain is delivered if the sender is included on the Safe List.
  • Click OK.

articles.name: Updating your phone number
articles.title: Updating your phone number
articles.body:
We use your mobile phone number for two-factor authentication. If your phone number changes, you'll need to update it in TaxCaddy.

Web

iOS

Android

TaxCaddy.com on PC, Mac, or tablet

Follow these steps to update your phone number using TaxCaddy.com on your PC, Mac, or tablet.

  1. Log in to taxcaddy.com

  2. On the upper right, click the User Menu and then click Settings.

  3. Click Security.

  4. Under Two Factor Authentication, click Change Phone.

  5. Provide your new mobile number then click Send Verification Code.

  6. Confirm your password in Password. Type the verification code that was sent to your new phone number via text message in the Verification Code field. Click NEXT.

    If you didn't receive a text message on your phone, click Resend code

  7. Your phone number has now been changed. Click Done.

iOS mobile app

Follow these steps to update your phone number on the iPhone mobile phone app.

  1. Sign in to the TaxCaddy mobile app.

  2. Tap More on the navigation tab bar then tap Settings.

  3. Tap Update Two-Factor Authentication.

  4. Provide your new number then tap Save.

    If you need to enter a phone number from another country then tap the left field with the flag icon, swipe up or down to locate the desired country, then tap to select the country code.

  5. Type the verification code that was sent to your new phone number via text message in Verification Code. Confirm your password in Password. Tap Submit.

  6. Your phone number has now been changed!

Android mobile app

Follow these steps to update your phone number on the Android mobile phone app.

  1. Sign in to the TaxCaddy mobile app.

  2. Tap the Menu icon.

  3. Tap Settings.

  4. Tap Update Two-Factor Authentication.

  5. Provide your new number then tap the Save icon on the upper right corner.

    If you need to enter a phone number from another country then tap the left field with the flag icon, swipe up or down to locate the desired country, then tap to select the country code.

  6. Type the verification code that was sent to your new phone number via text message in Verification Code. Confirm your password in Password. Tap the Save icon on the upper right corner.

  7. Your phone number has now been changed!

articles.name: Updating your Safe Senders list in Earthlink
articles.title: Updating your Safe Senders list in Earthlink
articles.body:
To make sure you receive emails from TaxCaddy, you should add taxcaddy.com to your list of safe senders. "Whitelist" the sender or an entire domain name to make sure our emails go to your inbox. If you have trouble receiving emails from TaxCaddy after following these instructions, contact support.

Allow a company (Domain)

  1. Click the Address Book button in the blue Web Mail bar at the top of the screen.

  2. Click the Manage Domains button at the top of the page. The list of allowed domains will open.

  3. Click the Add button.

  4. Type the Company (Domain) in the text field (e.g., taxcaddy.com).

  5. Click Allow This Company (Domain).

The domain will be added to the list and email from that domain will be allowed.

Notes: This topic is only for certain people:

* Those who have set spamBlocker to Suspect Email Blocking.

AND

*Those who want to be able to receive emails from everyone in a given company. To add a single email address to your Address Book, see below.

Allowing Email from Specific Senders

If you would like to receive email from someone, you must add that person's email address to your Address Book. To add a sender's email address to your Address Book:

Forward a Message to Your Inbox (from the Suspect Email folder)

If you forward a message from your Suspect Email folder to your Inbox, you have the option of adding the sender's email address to your Address Book so that future messages from that sender will go directly to your Inbox.

articles.name: Updating your Safe Senders list in Charter/Spectrum
articles.title: Updating your Safe Senders list in Charter/Spectrum
articles.body:
Comcast/Xfinity differs from many email providers in that it doesn't have a "whitelist" function. Instead, if you find emails in your spam folder that should not be there, mark them as "not spam".

If you have trouble receiving emails from TaxCaddy after following these instructions, contact support.

Removing Email from the Spam Folder

If an email message was incorrectly identified as spam, you can remove it from your spam folder:

  1. Open your Spam folder and choose the email you'd like to remove.
  2. Select Move from the options listed at the top of the email.
  3. Using the drop-down menu, designate which folder you would like to move the email to, and then select Move.
  4. You can also select Mark As and then Not Spam to avoid having similar emails sent to the spam folder in the future.

Note: Emails in the Spam folder are automatically deleted after 14 days.

articles.name: Updating your Safe Senders list in Gmail
articles.title: Updating your Safe Senders list in Gmail
articles.body:
To make sure you receive emails from TaxCaddy, you should add taxcaddy.com to your list of safe senders. "Whitelist" the sender or an entire domain name to make sure our emails go to your inbox. If you have trouble receiving emails from TaxCaddy after following these instructions, contact support.

Whitelist Existing Emails in Gmail

You can whitelist email senders in Gmail in two different ways. First, check your Spam folder. If you see an email there from TaxCaddy, you will want to add it to your whitelist.

Highlight the email and click on the "Not Spam" button. Future emails from TaxCaddy should now automatically go to your inbox.

You can use the second option if you haven't yet received an email from TaxCaddy to whitelist.

Create a Filter

You can create a filter to automatically send emails from certain domains to your inbox.

  1. Sign in to your Gmail.com account.
  2. On the upper right, click and then click Settings.
  3. Click Filters and Blocked Addresses and then click Create a new filter.
  4. In Domain or From, type taxcaddy.com.
  5. Click Create filter with this search.
  6. In When a message arrives that matches this search select Never send it to spam.
  7. Click the Create filter button.

articles.name: Updating your Safe Senders list in Mac OS X and macOS Mail
articles.title: Updating your Safe Senders list in Mac OS X and macOS Mail
articles.body:
To make sure you receive emails from TaxCaddy, you should add taxcaddy.com to your list of safe senders. "Whitelist" the sender or an entire domain name to make sure our emails go to your inbox. If you have trouble receiving emails from TaxCaddy after following these instructions, contact support.

How to Whitelist a Domain in Mac OS X Mail

To whitelist all email from a specific domain in the Mail app in Mac OS X or macOS:

  1. Select Mail | Preferences from the menu bar in Mac OS X Mail.
  2. Click the Rules tab.
  3. Click Add Rule.
  4. Type a name in the Description field, such as "Whitelist: taxcaddy.com" to identify the new rule.
  5. Make sure the criteria reads If any of the following conditions are met and that the From field is followed by Ends with.
  6. Enter the domain name you want to whitelist in the field next to the Ends with field. Add an @ sign before the domain name to make the filter specific. For example, to whitelist all mail from the taxcaddy.com domain type "@taxcaddy.com" into the field.
  7. Click the plus sign next to the last condition to add another domain with the same criteria if you want to whitelist several domains.
  8. In the Perform the following actions section set the three fields to Move Message, to the mailbox, and Inbox or a different target folder.
  9. Click OK to save the rule.
  10. Close the Rules window.

To make sure the rule is executed before other rules that might act on the same message for other reasons, drag it near the top of the rules list. If you have a filter that color-codes certain messages based on keywords in the subject, for example, make sure the domain whitelist rule is above that labeling rule.

articles.name: Updating your Safe Senders list in iCloud
articles.title: Updating your Safe Senders list in iCloud
articles.body:
To make sure you receive emails from TaxCaddy, you should add taxcaddy.com to your list of safe senders. "Whitelist" the sender or an entire domain name to make sure our emails go to your inbox. If you have trouble receiving emails from TaxCaddy after following these instructions, contact support.

Manage junk mail

Messages marked as junk are displayed with a junk mail icon . Because messages in the Junk folder are automatically deleted after 30 days, periodically check the Junk folder for messages that were marked as junk mistakenly.

Indicate that a message isnt junk

  1. Click the Junk folder in the sidebar.

  2. Select the message or messages, then click the Not Junk button in the top right of the message window.

The message is moved to your Inbox. Subsequent messages from the same sender are no longer automatically marked as junk.

Filter email automatically

You can set up rules to automatically filter incoming messages or reorganize messages youve already received using Mail on iCloud.com.

Set up rules to filter email

  1. In iCloud Mail, click the Action pop-up menu in the sidebar, then choose Rules.

  2. Click Add a Rule.

  3. Specify the filtering conditions.

    • In the Name or email address field, enter a senders full or partial name, a complete email address, or an email address domain (the part of the email address after the @ symbol). For this example, enter "taxcaddy.com".

    • Use the Then pop-up menus to set up the behavior of the rule.

  4. To add another rule, repeat steps 2 and 3.

    If you have multiple rules, theyre applied in the order in which they appear in the Rules list. To change the order, drag a rule up or down in the list. You can have up to 500 rules.

  5. Click Done.

Important: If you apply rules to a folder and then delete the folder or change its name, make sure to update the rules for those folders accordingly. For example, you cant forward messages to a deleted folder.

Change or remove email filtering rules

  1. Click the Action pop-up menu in the sidebar, then choose Rules.

  2. Select a rule you want to change, then do any of the following:

    • Change a rule: Click the Info button , specify new filtering conditions in the menus and text fields, then click Done.

    • Delete a rule: Select it, then press Delete.

    • Delete multiple rules: Select them, then press Delete.

    • Change the order of rules: Select them, then drag them up or down in the list.

      When you have multiple rules, theyre applied in the order in which they appear in the list.

  3. Click Done.

Note: It may take up to 15 minutes for new or changed rules to take effect on incoming messages.

articles.name: Updating your Safe Senders list in AT&T Web, BellSouth & SBC Email
articles.title: Updating your Safe Senders list in AT&T Web, BellSouth & SBC Email
articles.body:
To make sure you receive emails from TaxCaddy, you should add taxcaddy.com to your list of safe senders. "Whitelist" the sender or an entire domain name to make sure our emails go to your inbox. If you have trouble receiving emails from TaxCaddy after following these instructions, contact support.

Add a Contact to SBC Whitelist

  1. Find the From address from your most recent email from TaxCaddy.
  2. Open your SBCGlobal Address Book and then click the Add Contact button.
  3. Fill in the From address in the space provided.
  4. Click in the Save Contact button.

Or, Add a Filter

  1. Open your mailbox.
  2. Select Options on the top right hand side > Mail Options > Filters > Add Filter.
  3. Select Filters.
  4. Click "Add Filter".
  5. In the top row, labeled From Header, select contains from the pull down menu. Enter the address in the text box next to the pull down menu.
    Example: You can either give a specific email address or use @taxcaddy.com or *taxcaddy.com to whitelist the domain.
  6. Move down to the bottom where there is the option Move the message to. Select Inbox from the drop-down menu.
  7. Select the Add Filter button once again.

articles.name: Updating your Safe Senders list in Yahoo!
articles.title: Updating your Safe Senders list in Yahoo!
articles.body:
To make sure you receive emails from TaxCaddy, you should add taxcaddy.com to your list of safe senders. "Whitelist" the sender or an entire domain name to make sure our emails go to your inbox. If you have trouble receiving emails from TaxCaddy after following these instructions, contact support.

Whitelist Existing Emails in Yahoo! Mail

You can whitelist email senders in Yahoo! Mail in two different ways. First, check your Yahoo! Bulk folder. If you see an email there from TaxCaddy, you will want to add it to your whitelist.

Highlight the email and click on the "Not Spam" icon. Future emails from TaxCaddy should now automatically go to your inbox.

You can use the second option if you haven't yet received an email from TaxCaddy to whitelist.

Create a Filter

  1. Sign in to your Yahoo! Mail account.
  2. Point to Settings menu and click Settings.
  3. Click Filters and then Add.
  4. Enter a Filter Name.
  5. In Sender, type taxcaddy.com.
  6. Select Inbox as the folder to deliver the email to.
  7. Click Save and then click Save again.

articles.name: Updating your Safe Senders list in Hotmail, Windows, and MSN
articles.title: Updating your Safe Senders list in Hotmail, Windows, and MSN
articles.body:
To make sure you receive emails from TaxCaddy, you should add taxcaddy.com to your list of safe senders. "Whitelist" the sender or an entire domain name to make sure our emails go to your inbox. If you have trouble receiving emails from TaxCaddy after following these instructions, contact support.

There are two ways to whitelist emails in Hotmail Live, Windows Live and MSN.

Check the Junk Folder

If an email from a sender you want to whitelist has ended up in your junk folder, the process is simple.

  • Click "Show Content" to view the body of the email.
  • Click "mark as safe".

The sender will be added to your list of safe senders and all future emails will go to your inbox.

Manually Add the Sender to Your Safe List

If an existing email from the sender hasn't already been trapped in your junk folder, you can manually add him to your Safe List.

  • Click on "Options" in the upper right corner of your Hotmail screen.
  • Then click the link for "Safe and Blocked Senders" in the body of the page under Junk e-mail.
  • Click the "Safe Senders" link and enter the email address you want to whitelist.
  • Click "Add" to put it on your list.

articles.name: Updating your Safe Senders list in Outlook
articles.title: Updating your Safe Senders list in Outlook
articles.body:
To make sure you receive emails from TaxCaddy, you should add taxcaddy.com to your list of safe senders. "Whitelist" the sender or an entire domain name to make sure our emails go to your inbox. If you have trouble receiving emails from TaxCaddy after following these instructions, contact support.

Add one email address to the safe senders list with the Never Block Sender function

There are two handy functions - Never Block Sender and Block Sender in Outlook, which can help you quickly add your selected sender address in the mail message list to the safe senders list or blocked sender list with one click.

1. Select the message of the sender that you want to add to the whitelist, and click Home > Junk > Never Block Sender:

2. A prompt box will pop up to remind you the selected address has been added to the safe senders list. Click OK.

With this method, you can add one address into the safe list at a time. If you want to add multiple addresses, you need to add them one by one. If you don't have an email message from the sender, but know their email addresses, the Junk E-mail Options can help you.

Add multiple email addresses to the safe senders list with Junk E-mail Options

1. Click Home > Junk > Junk E-mail Options.

2. In the Junk E-mail Options dialog, click the Safe Senders tab, and then click the Add button.

3. In the pop up Add address or domain box, enter an e-mail address or domain of the person you want to whitelist to the text box (Ex: "taxcaddy.com"), and then click OK. For adding more email addresses to the whitelist, repeat this step.

4. Then click the OK button in the Junk Email Options dialog box.

Notes:
(1) If you check the Also trust e-mail from my Contacts option, your addresses in Contacts are considered safe senders.
(2) Some people might not be listed in your Contacts. If you want all such people to be considered safe senders, check the Automatically add people I e-mail to the Safe Senders List option.

articles.name: Updating your Safe Senders list in Centurylink/Centurytel
articles.title: Updating your Safe Senders list in Centurylink/Centurytel
articles.body:
To allow messages from specific e-mail addresses, follow the instructions below. You can also do this through the Spam Control menu button (in Microsoft Outlook, Outlook Express or Windows Mail), or by right-clicking the system tray icon. You can add, edit or remove individual e-mail addresses or whole domains to your allowed senders list. For example, if you add *@taxcaddy.com to your allowed senders list, all e-mail messages from the taxcaddy.com domain are allowed.

If you have trouble receiving emails from TaxCaddy after following these instructions, contact support.

To edit your list of trusted e-mail addresses:

  • On the main page, click Settings.
  • Select Internet > E-mail filtering.
  • Click Allow senders. The Allow senders settings page opens.

Choose one of the following actions.

To add a new e-mail address:

  • Click Add. The Add sender/domain dialog box opens.
  • In the Address field, enter the e-mail address or domain name (taxcaddy.com) from which you want to allow e-mail messages. You can add a short description for the new address in the Description field.
  • Click OK. The new e-mail address is now shown on your allowed senders list.

To edit an e-mail address:

  • In the list, select the e-mail address you want to edit, and click Edit. The Edit sender/domain dialog box opens.
  • Edit the selected e-mail address, and click OK.

To remove an e-mail address from the allowed senders list:

  • In the list, select the e-mail address you want to remove
  • Select Remove. The e-mail address is removed from the list.

articles.name: Updating your Safe Senders list in Comcast/Xfinity
articles.title: Updating your Safe Senders list in Comcast/Xfinity
articles.body:
If you have trouble receiving emails from TaxCaddy after following these instructions, contact support.

Comcast/Xfinity differs from many email providers in that it doesn't have a "whitelist" function. Instead, if you find emails in your spam folder that should not be there, mark them as "not spam".

Undo a Message Marked as Spam

  1. In XFINITY Connect, open the Spam folder from the left navigation pane.
  2. Check the box next to the message(s) that is not spam.
  3. Click the Not Spam button at the top of the page. or
  4. The email will be moved back to your inbox.
Note: You can also right-click on the email in the Spam folder and select Not Spam.
If you still have a problem with emails going to your spam folder, contact Comcast's Security Assurance group at 1-888-565-4329 and ask if there is a blocking issue with the sender's domain (taxcaddy.com).

articles.name: Updating your Safe Senders list in AOL
articles.title: Updating your Safe Senders list in AOL
articles.body:
To make sure you receive emails from TaxCaddy, you should add taxcaddy.com to your list of safe senders. "Whitelist" noreply@taxcaddy.com or the entire taxcaddy.com domain name to make sure our emails go to your inbox. If you have trouble receiving emails from TaxCaddy after following these instructions, contact support.

Whitelist an Email Sender in AOL

You must add the email address or corporate domain of the sender to your address book or custom sender list to make sure email gets delivered to your AOL inbox.

  • First, click on the "Spam Controls" link on the lower right side of your inbox screen.
  • A "Mail and Spam Controls" box will appear.
  • Now click on the "Customer Sender" list link and choose the "Allow email from ..." option.
  • Enter noreply@taxcaddy.com, then click "add" and "save."

In more recent versions of AOL, you can also simply add the name of the sender to your Contacts list. AOL will then recognize that this is someone you want to communicate with. Just click on the sender's email address. A menu should drop down. Select "Add Contact."

Whitelisting Senders and Domains Using AOL WebMail

Replying to an email from a sender you want to whitelist will automatically add the list as a safe sender if you're using AOL webmail.

Email from that domain will then be delivered straight to your inbox. The software will recognize that it's not spam.

articles.name: [INTERNAL] Linking within an article
articles.title: [INTERNAL] Linking within an article
articles.body:
Using anchor tags, you can link to a particular place in an article either from the same article or from another article. Follow these steps:

  1. First, you need to add a named anchor to the place you want to link. You have to do it in the HTML, so click the Source code button.



  2. In the source code, find the place you want to link to and add the following: <a name=PUT_A_NAME_HERE></a>
  3. To link to that spot from inside the same article, add a link like you normally would, but for the URL, put #PUT_A_NAME_HERE
  4. To link to that spot from a different article, but the articles URL and then add #PUT_A_NAME_HERE to the end of it.

articles.name: Changing the default tax year
articles.title: Changing the default tax year
articles.body:
You can change the default tax year in your settings. If no documents or returns have been uploaded for the new default tax year, you won't see any documents or returns by default. However, documents and returns uploaded for previous tax years won't be removed, and you can still see them by changing the tax year from the menu.

Click here to learn more about temporarily toggling to a different tax year.

Web

iOS

Android

TaxCaddy.com on PC, Mac or tablet

Follow these steps to change the default tax year when using TaxCaddy.com on your PC, Mac, or tablet.

  1. Log in to TaxCaddy.com. On the upper right, click the User Menu and then click Settings.

  2. On the Settings tab, click Default Tax Year.

  3. Under Default Tax Year, click the year you'd like to make default.

  4. On the confirmation dialog box, click Yes.

iOS mobile app

  1. Tap More on the navigation tab bar then tap Settings

  2. Tap Default Tax Year.

  3. Tap the year you would like to make your default tax year.

  4. Read the information then tap OK.

Android mobile app

  1. Tap the Menu icon

  2. Tap Settings.

  3. Tap Default Tax Year.

  4. Tap the year you would like to make your default tax year, and then tap OK.

  5. Read the information and tap OK.

articles.name: TaxCaddy Open Issues
articles.title: TaxCaddy Open Issues
articles.body:
The following is a list of known issues for TaxCaddy.

Known issues that have been resolved are tracked in a separate article.

Click here to view resolved issues.

Some users will see blank fields when logging in to TaxCaddy

      • Added 03/26/21
        • Description: After enabling Dark Mode, some users may see white text on a white background for the email and password login fields, causing them to appear blank.
        • Workaround: Option 1. Enter your credentials as usual, or copy/paste your email address and password into the blank white fields. After signing in, disable Dark Mode in Settings > Accessibility.
          Option 2. Use a different browser or private browsing without enabling Dark Mode.
        • Status: We are working to resolve this issue.
        • Issue ID: TCD-11561

Unable to connect Smart Links with "TIAA-CREF" or "Charles Schwab"

      • Added 03/04/21
        • Description: Users are unable to connect their Smart Links with TIAA-CREF or Charles Schwab.
        • Workaround: There is no known workaround.
        • Status: We are working to resolve this issue.
        • Issue ID:

Certain fillable fields not showing data when a user signs or reviews a document on a mobile device

      • Added 04/14/20
        • Description: Certain fields on a fillable PDF document not showing data after a user signs or reviews the document.
        • Workaround: There is no known workaround.
        • Status: We are working to resolve this issue.
        • Issue ID: SA-6071

Notes/Textbox annotation not saving in Firefox

      • Added 02/18/20
        • Description: Textbox/Notes annotations are not saving on Firefox.
        • Workaround: Use another supported browser (i.e. Chrome, Edge, Safari).
        • Status: We are working to resolve this issue.
        • Issue ID: MTH-5791

Using double quote("), less than (<), greater than (>) causes data to be lost on a Fillable Form

      • Added 01/03/20
        • Affected Product: TaxCaddy
        • Description: On a fillable form PDF, using single quote('), double quote("), less than (<), greater than (>) causes all the form data to be lost if you navigate away then return back.
        • Workaround: Avoid using double quote("), less than (<), and greater than (>) symbol if possible. You can still use these symbols, however, you must submit it as a finalized form before navigating away.
        • Status: We are working to resolve this issue.
        • Issue ID: MTH-5699

articles.name: Attaching files to messages (DRAFT / NOT MVP)
articles.title: Attaching files to messages (DRAFT / NOT MVP)
articles.body:
NOT MVP. LOWEST PRIORITY. WHEN FEATURE IS AVAILABLE, COPY THIS CONTENT TO "COMING SOON" ARTICLE -- MUST KEEP THAT ARTICLE URL TO AVOID BREAKING LINKS.

You can ask a question about a document that's already uploaded to your account using the ___ feature, or attach a document to a message. Files you attach to messages are not saved to your uploaded tax documents. If you need to upload a tax document, you can do so through the Tax Documents screen. Follow these steps to add an attachment to a message.

Click here to show/hide instructions for iOS and Android mobile phone app (coming soon!)

iOS and Android mobile phone app (coming soon)

Follow these steps to attach a file to a message using the iOS or Android mobile phone app.

MOBILE PROCEDURE

TaxCaddy.com on PC, Mac or tablet


Follow these steps to attach a file to a message using TaxCaddy.com on your PC, Mac or tablet.

  1. Sign in to TaxCaddy and click Messages.

  2. On the Message Threads panel, click the thread you want to attach a file to a message in, or create a new message thread (link to creating a new message thread). The thread opens.

  4. Browse to the file and then click Upload.

  5. Type a message (and if applicable, a subject) and then click Send. The attachment will be delivered to your CPA along with your message.

articles.name: Creating your account and logging in for the first time
articles.title: Creating your account and logging in for the first time
articles.body:
This article explains how to create your account and log in for the first time. If you've already logged in to TaxCaddy and are looking for information on how to log in again, click here.

If your spouse has already signed up with TaxCaddy, have your spouse invite you through Settings and use the link you're sent to sign up. 

Click here to learn how to add a spouse to your account.

Web

iOS

Android

TaxCaddy.com on PC, Mac, or tablet

Sign Up

Follow these steps to create a new account on TaxCaddy.com on your PC, Mac, or tablet.

TaxCaddy works best on Google Chrome browser, but is also supported on Firefox, Edge, and Safari. TaxCaddy is not supported on Internet Explorer. When using taxcaddy.com on a tablet, we recommend viewing in landscape screen orientation for best results.
  1. Whitelist TaxCaddy.com with your email provider to ensure our emails reach you.

  2. If you received a TaxCaddy email invitation from your tax professional, click Sign Up Free in that email to open the TaxCaddy enrollment screen in your browser.

    If you have not been sent an invite email from a tax professional and want to sign up on your own, go to TaxCaddy.com and click Sign up free in the top right.

  3. On the First Time Enrollment screen, enter the following information and then click Next.

    • First Name
    • Last Name
    • Email Address
    • Confirm Email Address
    • Mobile Number
    • Create Password
    • Confirm Password
    In some instances, auto-populated fields may cause the signup process to fail erroneously. Please enter fields manually.

    Omit any symbols when entering your phone number (i.e. hyphens, brackets, etc).

    Password field will be highlighted with a red border if the password is invalid or it does not match the Confirm Password field.

    A valid password must have the following:

    • A number

    • A special character (i.e. !@#$%^&*(){}:?><,.) 
      Spaces are not permitted

    • Both upper and lower case letters

    • 8 to 72 characters


    The red border will be removed once you enter a valid password.

  4. From the Security Question 1 list, select a question and then type your answer in the corresponding Answer 1 box. Repeat this step for Security Question 2 and then for Security Question 3. Click Next.
    We use these security questions to verify your identity if you forget your password. To safeguard your TaxCaddy account, choose strong security questions with answers that someone won't be able to guess or find on your social media accounts. Your answer must be greater than 3 characters.

  5. Once you have read the End User License Agreement, select I accept the terms stated above and then click Create Account.


  6. TaxCaddy directs you to check your email for a message confirming your email address.


  7. In the email verification message from TaxCaddy, click Verify My Email Address. 
    The link sent to verify your email address expires in 30 days.

  8. TaxCaddy confirms that your email address has been verified and you can now log in to your account. Type your email address into EMAIL and your password into PASSWORD. Then, click SIGN IN.

    You can click the Unmask icon to view your typed password. Similarly, you can click the Mask icon to mask (i.e *****) the password field.

  9. Alternatively, you can sign in from TaxCaddy.com on the web or TaxCaddy mobile app on Android and iOS.

Enabling Two Factor Authentication

When you log in to TaxCaddy, you'll need to provide a verification code that's sent as a text message to your mobile phone.

Follow these steps to enable Two Factor Authentication(2FA):

  1. This screen will inform you of the two-factor authentication process. Click SETUP TWO FACTOR AUTHENTICATION.

  2. Provide your mobile phone number, then click SEND VERIFICATION CODE. You will receive a verification code in a few minutes.

  3. Provide the verification code that was sent to your mobile phone, and click NEXT.

    The verification code expires after 5 minutes.

Setup Default Tax Year

Next, you can select a default tax year. Each time you log in, the selected default tax year will show you documents, invoices, and tax returns associated with that tax year. You can also toggle between tax years at any time irrespective of the default tax year.

To skip this step, click Skip this.

You can change the default tax year from the Settings screen.

Click here to learn more about changing the default tax year.

Setup Connection Request

You will see a connection request only if a tax professional has requested permission to connect with you.

If you didn't receive a connection request, then skip to the next step. You can also accept connection request from the Overview screen when your tax professional sends you the request.

Click here to learn more about connecting with your tax professional.

Granting permission allows the tax professional to:

  • Access your tax documents

  • Communicate with you

  • Send you letters, questionnaires, and other requests

  • Upload your tax return for you to review.

To accept a connection request, click ACCEPT CONNECTION.

To skip the setup process click Skip this. If you choose to skip the setup process then you can connect with your tax professional from the Overview screen.

Click here to learn more about connecting with your tax professional.

Click here to learn more about disconnecting from your tax professional.

Add Spouse

You'll now be prompted to invite your spouse to join your account.

If you do not have a spouse, click I do not have a spouse, and click CONTINUE.

You can either enter your spouse's email address and click SEND INVITATION, or click Skip this to log in without entering any spouse information. You can also add an additional user at a later time in Settings.

Click CONTINUE.

You're now logged in to TaxCaddy!

iOS mobile app

Follow these steps to create a new TaxCaddy account on your iPhone mobile phone app.

  1. Whitelist TaxCaddy.com with your email provider to ensure our emails reach you.

  2. Download and install the TaxCaddy mobile app.

    Click here to view more information on downloading the TaxCaddy mobile app.

  3. Start the TaxCaddy mobile app and tap Sign-Up.

  4. Type the following information then tap Next:

    • First Name

    • Last Name

    • Email

    • Confirm Email

    • Country Code

    • Mobile Number

    We recommend you create your TaxCaddy account using the same email address your tax professional has on file. If you choose to create your account using a different email address, contact support after logging in to TaxCaddy for the first time to ensure your tax professional can connect with your account.

    Omit any symbols when entering your phone number (i.e. hyphens, brackets, etc).

  5. Type a Password to use with your TaxCaddy account. Type the same password again into Confirm Password. Onscreen guidance helps you select a strong password.

  6. Under Security Question 1, tap the Q with a question next to it and select a security question. Type your answer in the corresponding Answer 1 box. Repeat this step for Security Question 2 and Security Question 3. Then, tap Next.

    We use these security questions to verify your identity if you forget your password. To safeguard your TaxCaddy account, choose strong security questions with answers that someone won't be able to guess or find on your social media accounts. Your answer must be greater than 3 characters.

  7. Once you have read the End User License Agreement, select I accept the terms stated above and then tap Create Account.

  8. Check your email for an email verification message from TaxCaddy. Tap Verify My Email Address. Your email address is confirmed.

    The link sent to verify your email address expires in 30 days.

  9. In the TaxCaddy app, type your email address into Username and your password into Password. Then, tap Login.

  10. Now you'll need to set up two-factor authentication. When you log in to TaxCaddy, you'll need to provide a verification code that's sent as a text message to your mobile phone. This screen will inform you of the two-factor authentication process. Tap SETUP TWO-FACTOR AUTHENTICATION.

  11. Provide your mobile phone number, and then tap SEND VERIFICATION CODE. If you don't see the SEND VERIFICATION CODE button, tap the background to lower the number pad.

  12. Provide the verification code that was sent to your mobile phone, and tap SUBMIT.

  13. Next, you can select a default tax year. Each time you log in, the selected default tax year will show you documents, invoices, and tax returns associated with that tax year. You can toggle between tax years at any time irrespective of the default tax year. You can also change the default tax year from the Settings screen. After you select the default tax year, tap CONTINUE.

    To skip the setup process, tap SKIP.

    You can change the default tax year from the Settings screen.

    Tap here to learn more about changing the default tax year.

  14. The Connection Request step only appears if you have a pending connection request from your tax professional.

    If you didn't receive a connection request, then skip to the next step. You can also accept connection request from the Overview screen when your tax professional sends you the request.

    Tap here to learn more about connecting with your tax professional.

    Granting permission allows the tax professional to:

    • Access your tax documents

    • Communicate with you

    • Send you letters, questionnaires, and other requests

    • Upload your tax return for you to review.

    To accept a connection request, tap ACCEPT CONNECTION.

    To skip the setup process tap SKIP. If you choose to skip the setup process then you can connect with your tax professional from the Overview screen.

    Tap here to learn more about connecting with your tax professional.

    Tap here to learn more about disconnecting from your tax professional.

  15. You'll now be prompted to invite your spouse to join your account.

    If you do not have a spouse, tap I do not have a spouse, and tap CONTINUE.

    You can either enter your spouse's information then tap SEND INVITATION, or tap SKIP to log in without entering any spouse information. You can also add an additional user at a later time in Settings.

  16. You're now logged in to TaxCaddy!

Android mobile app

Follow these steps to create a new TaxCaddy account on your Android mobile phone app.

  1. Whitelist TaxCaddy.com with your email provider to ensure our emails reach you.

  2. Download and install the TaxCaddy mobile app.

    Click here to view more information on downloading the TaxCaddy mobile app.

  3. Start the TaxCaddy mobile app and tap Sign-Up.

  4. Type your First Name, Last Name, Email, Confirm email, Country Code, Mobile Number and then tap NEXT.

    We recommend you create your TaxCaddy account using the same email address your tax professional has on file. If you choose to create your account using a different email address, contact support after logging in to TaxCaddy for the first time to ensure your tax professional can connect with your account.

    Omit any symbols when entering your phone number (i.e. hyphens, brackets, etc).

  5. Type a password into New Password to use with your TaxCaddy account. Type the same password again into Confirm Password. Onscreen guidance helps you select a strong password. Tap NEXT.

  6. Under Question 1, tap the question and select a security question. Type your answer in the corresponding Answer 1 box. Repeat this step for Question 2 and then for Question 3. You can tap the picklist icon to change the security question. Then, tap NEXT.

    We use these security questions to verify your identity if you forget your password. To safeguard your TaxCaddy account, choose strong security questions with answers that someone won't be able to guess or find on your social media accounts. Your answer must be greater than 3 characters.

  7. Once you have read the End User License Agreement, tap I accept the terms of the agreement and then tap NEXT.

  8. Check your email for an email verification message from TaxCaddy. Tap confirm my email address. Your email address is confirmed.

    The link sent to verify your email address expires in 30 days.

  9. In the TaxCaddy app, type your email address into Email and your password into Password. Then, tap Log in.


  10. Now you'll need to set up two-factor authentication. When you log in to TaxCaddy, you'll need to provide a verification code that's sent as a text message to your mobile phone. This screen will inform you of the two-factor authentication process. Tap SETUP TWO-FACTOR AUTHENTICATION.

  11. Provide your mobile phone number, and then tap SEND VERIFICATION CODE.

  12. Provide the verification code that was sent to your mobile phone, and tap SUBMIT.

  13. Next, you can select a default tax year. Each time you log in, the selected default tax year will show you documents, invoices, and tax returns associated with that tax year. You can toggle between tax years at any time irrespective of the default tax year. You can also change the default tax year from the Settings screen. After you select the default tax year, tap CONTINUE.

    To skip the setup process, tap SKIP.

    You can change the default tax year from the Settings screen.

    Tap here to learn more about changing the default tax year.

  14. The Connection Request step only appears if you have a pending connection request from your tax professional.

    If you didn't receive a connection request, then skip to the next step. You can also accept connection request from the Overview screen when your tax professional sends you the request.

    Tap here to learn more about connecting with your tax professional.

    Granting permission allows the tax professional to:

    • Access your tax documents

    • Communicate with you

    • Send you letters, questionnaires, and other requests

    • Upload your tax return for you to review.

    To accept a connection request, tap ACCEPT CONNECTION.

    To skip the setup process tap SKIP. If you choose to skip the setup process then you can connect with your tax professional from the Overview screen.

    tap here to learn more about connecting with your tax professional.

    tap here to learn more about disconnecting from your tax professional.

  15. You'll now be prompted to invite your spouse to join your account.

    If you do not have a spouse, tap I do not have a spouse, and tap CONTINUE.

    You can either enter your spouse's information then tap SEND INVITATION, or tap SKIP to log in without entering any spouse information. You can also add an additional user at a later time in Settings.

  16. You're now logged in to TaxCaddy!

articles.name: [INTERNAL] Intro to TaxCaddy: Navigation (DRAFT)
articles.title: [INTERNAL] Intro to TaxCaddy: Navigation (DRAFT)
articles.body:
This is the first in a series of articles that make up Intro to TaxCaddy for Support. These articles outline all the features of TaxCaddy, with emphasis on areas where users may get stuck and contact Support.

This article covers the elements on the navigation bar while using TaxCaddy.com on a computer or tablet.

CPA Logo

If the user's account is connected to a CPA, the CPA logo appears on the left. If the user is not connected to a CPA, a logo is not visible.

Tax Year

Next to the CPA logo is the tax year drop-down. By default, the tax year is set to the current tax year, but users can access previous or future years through this. Each tax year is like a reset on the account -- each year, taxpayers accept a new connection request from their CPA and all documents and information stays associated only with the year they were used to prepare taxes.

Navigation tabs

The four screens on the navigation bar are Overview, Tax Documents, Messages, and My Return. The screen you are currently on is highlighted in green.

Search

Search results include detailed information about the item. Messages, documents, questionnaire questions, and the return can all be included in results and their type is indicated by an icon.

User menu

The user menu provides access to the following:

  • Settings (More on account settings later.)
  • Help Center
  • Log Out

Help Center

Users can access the Help Center by clicking the icon on the far right of the navigation bar.

CLICK HERE TO GO TO THE NEXT ARTICLE
Intro to TaxCaddy: Overview
