articles.name: Viewing a tax return
articles.title: Viewing a tax return
articles.body:
When your tax professional is done preparing your tax return, they will upload it to Tax Returns.

If your tax professional has not uploaded a tax return for you, TaxCaddy will let you know.

Web

iOS

Android

TaxCaddy.com on PC, Mac, or tablet

Follow these steps to view your tax return when using TaxCaddy.com on your PC, Mac or tablet.

  1. Sign in to TaxCaddy.com

  2. Under Quick access options, click View ... Tax Returns panel to see tax returns uploaded for the current tax year.

    The View Tax Returns panel will say 'You dont have a return yet' if your tax professional has not yet uploaded the tax return to TaxCaddy.

    If you have any questions about your tax return then you can send your tax professional a message. Click here to learn more about sending a message to your tax professional.

  3. Alternatively, you can also click Tax Returns on the navigation panel.

  4. Select the tax year. Tax returns are only visible under the tax year they were created in by your tax professional.

  5. Click the tax return you want to view.

    After your tax return opens, you can swap between tax returns using the menu located on the upper right corner of the Document Viewer.

iOS mobile app

Follow these steps to view your tax return on your iOS mobile phone app.

  1. Log in to the TaxCaddy mobile app.

  2. Tap Tax Returns on the tab bar.



  3. If visible, you can swipe left or right to view different summary items.


  4. Tap the return you want to view.



  5. The tax return opens in the viewer.

Android mobile app

Follow these steps to view your tax return on your Android mobile phone app.

  1. Log in to the TaxCaddy mobile app.
  2. Tap the menu.



  3. Tap Tax Returns.



  4. Tap the tax return you want to view.



  5. The tax return opens in the viewer.

articles.name: Release Notes 2019-11-07, Android 3.10 (Previous Tax Year, Smart Links, Design Updates)
articles.title: Release Notes 2019-11-07, Android 3.10 (Previous Tax Year, Smart Links, Design Updates)
articles.body:
Hi! Here's what's new in TaxCaddy on Android!

Previous tax years

When viewing a previous tax year(s), you may now see a banner notification displaying Warning: Your Tax Pro Has Limited Access. Once a previous tax year(s) has passed a certain time period limit, tax professionals can choose not to access documents, messages, or any other information from that tax year.

Click here to learn more about viewing different tax years.

Push notification for broken Smart Links

You will now receive a push notification when your established Smart Links connection breaks. You can tap the push notification to view the Smart Links screen.

Click here to learn more about fixing Smart Links.

Click here to learn more about updating your notification preferences.

Note: This notification only appears for Smart Links that have been successfully established over an hour.

Design Updates

Changes to the UI were made to improve the user experience. The following features have been redesigned with an updated look:

Invoices

The following Invoices screens have been redesigned with an updated UI:

Click here to learn more about Invoices.

Click here to learn more about paying invoices with a bank account.

Click here to learn more about paying invoices with a credit card.

Done Uploading

The Done Uploading screen has been redesigned with an updated UI.

Click here to learn more Done Uploading.

articles.name: Viewing documents in Fullscreen
articles.title: Viewing documents in Fullscreen
articles.body:
Document Viewer can expand to fill your entire screen with its fullscreen mode. Fullscreen helps by utilizing maximum screen space on all device sizes and it's a great way to only focus on the document.

To view a document in fullscreen mode, click the floating Fullscreen icon on the lower left corner of the document viewer.

You can also use the zoom feature in Fullscreen mode to utilize the maximum screen space.

Exiting Fullscreen

To exit fullscreen, move the mouse to the top of the window, click the Exit fullscreen icon when it appears on the screen. Alternatively, you can press ESC or F11 on the keyboard.

articles.name: Paying Invoices
articles.title: Paying Invoices
articles.body:
Your Tax Professional can charge you for their services by creating invoices. These invoices can be viewed, paid, and downloaded.

Web

iOS

Android

TaxCaddy.com on PC, Mac, or tablet

Follow these steps to make a payment on your invoice when using TaxCaddy.com on your PC, Mac, or tablet.

  1. Sign in to TaxCaddy.com

  2. On the navigation menu, click Invoices.

  3. Select the applicable Tax Year.

    Invoices are only visible under the tax year they were created in by your Tax Professional. Your Tax Professional can place invoices due from a different tax year under the selected tax year. For example, your Tax Professional can have an invoice that was due the previous year and place it under the current year.

  4. The list of invoices created by your Tax Professional will appear for the selected tax year.

    You can only make payments on invoices with Unpaid or Past Due status.

    Invoices with the status Refunded are invoices that the Tax Professional marked as Refunded.

  5. Click an Unpaid of Past Due invoice document tile to view it in the Document Viewer.

    Alternatively, you can click the Menu icon , then click View from the available options.

  6. Once you have verified the invoice amount in the Document Viewer window, click the Pay Now icon to make the payment.

  7. When the Pay Invoice dialog box appears, you can review the invoice details on top (i.e Amount Due, Due Date, Invoice Name, and Date Issued).

  8. Select your preferred method of payment under Select Payment Method. If your Tax Professional accepts Credit Card and Bank Account as a method of payment then you will see both options available.

    Click here to learn more about making a payment with a Credit Card.

    Click here to learn more about making a payment with a Bank Account.

    If your Tax Professional accepts Credit Card only, then you can only pay with a Credit Card.

    Similarly, if your Tax Professional accepts Bank Account only, then you will only see Bank Account as a method of payment.

  9. Once you have made the payment, wait for the payment process to complete.

  10. A stamp is placed on the invoice when you pay an invoice or the invoice has been marked as paid by your Tax Professional.

iOS mobile app

Follow these steps to pay invoices on your iOS mobile phone app.

  1. Log in to the TaxCaddy mobile app.

  2. Tap More on the navigation tab bar then tap Invoice.

  3. Tap the Tax Year on the top left.

    Invoices are only visible under the tax year they were created in by your Tax Professional. Your Tax Professional can place invoices due from a different tax year in a selected tax year. For example, your Tax Professional can make an invoice due the previous year under the current year.

    Select the applicable tax year by sliding the tax year up or down. After selecting the tax year, tap SELECT.

  4. The list of invoices created by your Tax Professional will appear for the selected tax year.

    Invoices can appear inside three sections:

    • Due: Invoices that need to be paid.
    • Paid: Invoices that have been paid.
    • Refunded: Paid invoices that have been refunded by your tax professional.
    • In Process: Invoice that has been paid and is still in processing.
    You can only pay invoices under the Invoice Due section.

    Indicates the invoices is past due.

    Indicates the invoice has been Paid.

  5. Under the Due section, tap on an Invoice.

  6. When the Invoice opens in the PDF Viewer screen, review the invoice then tap Pay Invoice.

    Alternatively, you can tap the Menu icon on the invoice you want to pay.

    When the dialog box appears, tap Pay Now.

  7. When the Invoice Payment screen appears, you can review the invoice details on top (i.e Amount Due, Due Date, Invoice Name, and Date Issued).

  8. You can select your preferred method of payment under Select Payment Method. If your Tax Professional accepts Credit Card and Bank Account as a method of payment, then you will see both options available.

    Click here to learn more about making a payment with a Credit Card.

    Click here to learn more about making a payment with a Bank Account.

    If your Tax Professional accepts Credit Card only, then you can only pay with a Credit Card. Similarly, if your Tax Professional accepts Bank Account only, then you will only see Bank Account as a method of payment.

  9. You will see a confirmation screen once the payment has been submitted successfully. Tap Done to close the Payment Due screen. Your payment status will change to In Processing and you will receive a confirmation email within 5 business days.

    Bank account confirmation:

    Credit Card confirmation:

  10. A stamp is placed on the invoice once you make a payment on an invoice or the invoice has been marked as paid by your Tax Professional

Android mobile app

Follow these steps to pay invoices on your Android mobile phone app.

  1. Log in to the TaxCaddy mobile app.
  2. Tap the Menu icon

  3. Tap Invoices

  4. Tap the Tax Year icon to select the applicable tax year.
    Invoices are only visible under the tax year they were created in by your Tax Professional. Your Tax Professional can place invoices due from a different tax year in a selected tax year. For example, your Tax Professional can make an invoice due the previous year under the current year.

  5. The list of invoices created by your Tax Professional will appear for the selected tax year.



    Invoices can appear inside three sections:
    • Invoice Due
    • Paid Invoices
    • Refunded
    • In Process
    You can only pay invoices under the Invoice Due section.

    Indicates the invoices is past due.
    Indicates the invoice has been Paid.
  6. Under the Invoices Due section, tap on an Invoice.

  7. When the Invoice opens in the PDF Viewer screen, review the invoice then tap Pay Invoice.



    Alternatively, you can tap the Menu icon on the invoice you want to pay.



    When the dialog box appears, tap Pay Now.

  8. When the Invoice Payment screen appears, you can review the invoice details on top (i.e Amount Due, Due Date, Invoice Name, and Date Issued).

  9. You can select your preferred method of payment under Select Payment Method. If your Tax Professional accepts Credit Card and Bank Account as a method of payment then you will see both options available.

    If your Tax Professional accepts Credit Card only, then you can only pay with a Credit Card. Similarly, if your Tax Professional accepts Bank Account only, then you will only see Bank Account as a method of payment.

    Click here to learn more about making a payment with a Credit Card.

    Click here to learn more about making a payment with a Bank Account.

  10. A stamp is placed on the invoice once you make a payment on an invoice or the invoice has been marked as paid by your Tax Professional

articles.name: [INTERNAL] Support Tool Smart Links Definitions
articles.title: [INTERNAL] Support Tool Smart Links Definitions
articles.body:
Here's a brief overview of the Support Tools page.

The Support Tool table is divided into the following columns:

Institution Name

Shows the Financial Institutions Smart Link Name.

Status

Shows a list of possible status updates a user account could go through:

  • Created When the account is first created, login details not yet sent. Should only last 1-2 seconds.
  • Connecting A financial institution link is being attempted. This should only last a minute or two.
  • Completed - A link has been established.
  • Question TaxCaddy is awaiting input from the user.

    Possibilities include:
    • Username/password was wrong and must be entered again
    • Selection of phone number or email address for Two-Factor Authentication code delivery
    • Two-Factor Authentication code
    • Pin number
    • Challenge question
    • Multiple choice questions
    • Branch Code
    • Other issues requiring the user to log directly into their financial institutions account:
      • Account is locked
      • Account not supported
      • Account profile must be set up
      • Account needs to sign up to go paperless
      • Once the user has logged in to their financial institutions website, they can click Retry to fix the issue



  • Answered - The user has provided us with new information that we are relaying to the financial institution. Should only last a few minutes.
  • Incorrect This status will appear for a few seconds if user input is incorrect.
  • Error Unknown issue with FileThis or financial institution.
  • Waiting Smart Link successfully established. A fetch attempt will be made at the next attempt date.
  • Uploading A document retrieval is in progress. This happens once every 24 hours.

Log in Status

Shows past log in attempts.

  • Never A login has not been attempted yet
  • Pending A login attempt has been initiated sometime in the past, but the user has not yet passed all the steps to finish.
  • Done Login was successful, the Smart Link is established.

Smart Link Creation Date

Shows the date and time the Smart Link was first created (whether successfully or not). Deleting and re-adding a Smart Link resets this date.

Last Retrieval Date

Shows the last time an automated document retrieval. If the date reads as 31 Dec 1969, then no retrieval has been ever attempted.

Next Attempt Date

Shows the next date in which we will automatically check for relevant documents to be retrieved.

articles.name: Downloading a tax payment voucher
articles.title: Downloading a tax payment voucher
articles.body:
The tax payment voucher can be downloaded from Tax Payments.

Web

iOS

Android

TaxCaddy.com on PC, Mac or tablet

Follow these steps to download your tax payment voucher when using TaxCaddy.com on your PC, Mac or tablet.

  1. Sign in to TaxCaddy.com

  2. Click Tax Payments.

  3. Select the tax year. Tax payment vouchers are only visible under the tax year they were created in by your tax professional. If the voucher is past due from the previous year, it can still be placed under the current year by your tax professional.

  4. Click the Menu icon then click Download to begin downloading the tax payment voucher.

  5. Alternatively, you can also download the document from the document viewer window. When you have the file open for viewing, click the Download icon on the lower-left corner.

    Click here to learn more about viewing a tax payment voucher.

iOS mobile app

Follow these steps to download your tax payment voucher on your iOS mobile phone app.

  1. Log in to the TaxCaddy mobile app.

  2. Tap More on the navigation tab then tap Tax Payments.

  3. Tap the Menu icon corresponding to the tax payment voucher you want to download, then tap Share on the action sheet.

  4. Tap the app with which you want to share the tax return.

Android mobile app

Follow these steps to download your tax payment voucher on your Android mobile phone app.

  1. Log in to the TaxCaddy mobile app.

  2. Tap the Menu icon

  3. Tap Tax Payments.

  4. Tap the Menu icon corresponding to the tax payment voucher you want to download.

  5. Tap Share.

  6. Tap the app with which you want to share the tax return.

articles.name: Multi-Account Management
articles.title: Multi-Account Management
articles.body:
If one or more other users add you to their account, you'll be able to manage your own account as well as the other accounts. When you log in to TaxCaddy, you'll see the Multi-Account Management Dashboard. You can use the Dashboard to manage others' TaxCaddy accounts in most of the ways you can manage your own. However as an Admin user, you cannot sign documents, mark documents as reviewed, and access your Settings (i.e. Changing your name, email address, profile picture, password, security questions, or push notification settings).

Web

iOS

Android

TaxCaddy.com on PC, Mac or tablet

When you log in, the Select User screen appears if other users have requested to add you as their additional user.

Click here to learn about adding a spouse or admin users.

Tiles on the Dashboard represent your own account as well as the accounts to which you have access. The tile representing your own account is on the left and larger than the others.

If a user has invited you to join their account and you have not yet accepted or declined the connection, you'll see Decline and Connect options on their tile. To connect with them, click Connect.

If you've already accepted a user's request, those links will not be present. Their tile will show their tax year as well as the number of Tax Pro Requests they have.

If a user has revoked your access, you'll see them appear as a Disconnected User. Click Remove on the user's tile to remove them from your dashboard. Multi-Account management dashboard will not appear if all remaining users are removed

When you click on a connected client's tile, you'll see that person's TaxCaddy account. On the upper right corner, you will see the name of the person whose account you're currently managing.

To switch the account to another user, click the user profile menu to see the drop-down menu, then click Switch Account.

The Switch Account option is only visible if another user(s) has added you as an additional users.

iOS mobile app

The Select User screen only appears if other users have requested to add you as their additional user.

You can search for a user using the search box at the top.

If a user has invited you to join their account and you have not yet accepted or declined the connection, you'll see Decline and Connect options. To connect with them, tap Connect.

If you've already accepted a user's request, those links will not be present. You can see their tax year as well as the number of Tax Pro Requests they have.

As an Admin user, you can tap the Admin user icon to view the user selection screen.

Android mobile app

The Select User screen only appears if other users have requested to add you as their additional user.

As an Admin user, you can tap the Admin user icon to view the user selection screen.

You can search for a user using the search button at the top.

If a user has invited you to join their account and you have not yet accepted or declined the connection, you'll see Decline and Connect options. To connect with them, tap Connect.

If you've already accepted a user's request, those links will not be present. You can see their tax year as well as the number of Tax Pro Requests they have.

After tapping a user, you'll see that person's TaxCaddy account with their name on the top. Tap their name to go back to the user selection screen. In the example below, Adam Admin is currently viewing Tina Taxpayer's account.

articles.name: Importing saved or downloaded documents on your phone with TaxCaddy
articles.title: Importing saved or downloaded documents on your phone with TaxCaddy
articles.body:
You can upload documents that have been saved or downloaded to your phone by sharing them with TaxCaddy when viewing the documents.

You can also upload documents by taking a photo or uploading them from Google Drive or Dropbox.

Click here to learn about other ways to upload documents.

iOS

Android

iOS mobile app

Follow these steps to upload a document you're viewing with the TaxCaddy iPhone mobile phone app.

  1. Open the document menu on your phone.
  2. Tap the share button.
  3. Tap Open with TaxCaddy. If you don't see Open with TaxCaddy on the list of available apps, tap More.

  4. Tap Open with TaxCaddy.

  5. Follow the prompts to categorize the document.
  6. TaxCaddy confirms your document was uploaded and the document is added to Uploaded Tax Documents.

Android mobile app

Follow these steps to upload a document you're viewing with the TaxCaddy Android mobile phone app.

  1. Open the document on your phone.
  2. Tap the Menu icon.
  3. Tap Send file.

  4. On the app drawer, tap TaxCaddy.

  5. Follow the prompts to categorize the document.
  6. TaxCaddy confirms your document was uploaded and the document is added to Uploaded Tax Documents.

articles.name: TaxCaddy Resolved Issues
articles.title: TaxCaddy Resolved Issues
articles.body:
The following is a list of resolved issues.

Known issues that are still in progress are tracked in a separate article.

Click here to view current known issues.

RESOLVED - Certified Mail tracking number for payments doesn't appear in the email

      • Added 05/21/20
        • Description: Users who paid tax payments by check using USPS Certified Mail are not currently receiving the email that contains the tracking number.
        • Workaround: The tracking number will appear in TaxCaddy in the tax payment's Document Viewer (upper right corner) within 1 business days of being submitted.
        • Status: This issue was resolved 09/01/2020
        • Issue ID: SA-6658

RESOLVED - Option to pay tax payments by check is temporarily unavailable

      • Added 08/12/20
        • Description: Pay by Check option is currently unavailable. If you have recently used the Pay by Check option to mail your check to the taxing authority then your check delivery will not be impacted.
        • Workaround: You can pay your tax payments using other methods such as electronically or by mail.
        • Status: This issue was resolved 08/21/2020
        • Issue ID: SA-6782

RESOLVED - Unable to select a different country when entering spouse's phone number

      • Added 02/18/20
        • Description: Spouse users attempting to e-signing a document from the taxpayer's main account are not able to change the country code from U.S. to another country from the drop-down menu.
        • Workaround: You can add a phone number with the country code (i.e. +1 for Canada) or the spouse user can log in to their own account to e-sign the document.
        • Status: This issue was resolved 03/30/2020
        • Issue ID: DOP-6593

RESOLVED - Smart Links needs attention notification

      • Added 02/25/20
        • Description: Some users are incorrectly receiving notification about broken Smart Links through SMS or Push notification.
          • Updated: We have temporarily disabled broken smart link notifications while we troubleshoot the issue. You should not receive any new broken Smart Links notifications after 2:00 pm (PST) 02/25/20.
        • Workaround: You can temporarily disable notifications.
        • Status: This issue was resolved.
        • Issue ID: TCSUP-1721

RESOLVED - Uploading a document does not remove it from the Tax Pro Request

      • Added 01/21/20
        • Description: Requested documents are not removed from the Tax Pro Request panel if you upload a document directly then manually associate it with a requested item after the upload process.
        • Workaround: There is no known workaround. However, if you have not already uploaded the document then you can upload a requested item from the document menu, reply with an amount, mark it as already provided.
        • Status: This issue was resolved 02/05/2020
        • Issue ID: MTH-5700

RESOLVED - Fillable PDF data not being saved after the document is signed, reviewed or uploaded (via Complete Form)

      • Added 03/11/20
        • Description: Data entered into a Fillable PDF on 3/10/2020 or 3/11/2020 was not being saved when the document was signed, reviewed, or uploaded (via Complete Form). This issue has been resolved. However, if you signed, reviewed, or uploaded a Fillable PDF on 3/10/2020 or 3/11/2020 (before 12 pm EST) then we recommend you view the document on the Uploaded Documents tab to confirm all the information is still on the PDF document.
        • Workaround: If you signed/reviewed a Fillable PDF document on 3/10/2020 or 3/11/2020 then verify if the data you entered appears when viewing the document on your Uploaded Documents tab. If your data does not appear on the Fillable PDF form then message your tax professional
          to re-upload the Sign/Review request. If you uploaded the document (via Complete Form) then delete the document to restore the document as a requested item.
        • Status: This issue was resolved on 3/11/2020 (12 pm EST)
        • Issue ID: MTH-5795

RESOLVED - Smart Links dialog box not updating when logging in

      • Added 02/27/20
        • Description: When adding a Smart Links, if the login attempt fails, you don't see the input form in order to try again. If the login attempt is successful then you will see the spinner indicating Smart Links is still attempting to log in. Exit the dialog box then click on that Smart Links again to see the update.
        • Workaround: Click Done to close the dialog box. Click the Smart Links again to
        • Status: This issue was resolved on 02/28/2020
        • Issue ID: DOP-6646

RESOLVED - Smart Links not fetching documents

      • Added 02/06/20
        • Description: Smart Links that have been successfully connected are currently not fetching any documents.
        • Workaround: There is no known workaround.
        • Status: We are working to resolve this issue on high priority.
        • Issue ID:

RESOLVED - Radio options on fillable forms appear blank on subsequent visits

      • Added 02/12/20
        • Description: If the fillable form you are entering information in has a radio button, then on a subsequent visit, any radio buttons that were previously selected will appear blank.
        • Workaround: You can fill out the form in a single session then sign/review the document without navigating away from the page. Alternatively, if you plan to fill the form over multiple sessions then you can use TaxCaddy mobile app for iOS and Android.
        • Status: This issue was resolved on 02/16/202
        • Issue ID:

RESOLVED - Amount values with a comma appear as "0" (zero) in a Fillable Organizer Template

      • Added 01/24/20
        • Description: When completing a fillable form, amount appears as 0 (zero) if the amount entered includes a comma (i.e. 20,000).
        • Workaround: Do not use a comma when entering amounts.
        • Status: This issue was resolved on 02/16/202
        • Issue ID:

RESOLVED - Some users are seeing blank pages in the Document Viewer from Firefox

      • Added 02/13/20
        • Description: Certain documents appear blank in the Document Viewer when using the Firefox browser.
        • Workaround: Use another supported browser (i.e. Chrome, Edge, Safari), or download the document on a secure device then view it on a PDF Viewer like Acrobat Reader.
        • Status: This issue was resolved on 02/16/2020
        • Issue ID: TCSUP-1472

RESOLVED - Viewing Tax Return does not remove it from the Tax Pro Request

      • Added 01/21/20
        • Description: Viewing a Tax Return does not remove it as a requested item under the Tax Pro Request panel on the Overview screen.
        • Workaround: There is no known workaround.
        • Status: This issue was resolved on 01/29/2020
        • Issue ID: MTHU-6413

RESOLVED - [iOS] Signature icon not appearing

      • Added 7/30/19
        • Description: On iOS, the floating Signature icon does not appear on the document if it was opened from the Overview screen. This only occurs if you only have a single requested document available on the Overview screen.
        • Workaround: To sign the document, open the document from the Documents screen instead.
        • Status: We are working to resolve 09/12/2019 on iOS 3.8
        • Issue ID: TCM-2592

RESOLVED - Unable to switch documents from the Document Viewer

      • Added 08/16/19
        • Description: Unable to switch between documents in the Document Viewer from the drop down menu located on the upper right corner.
        • Workaround: Open the document directly from the Document screen.
        • Status: This was resolved 08/19/2019.
        • Issue ID: MTHU-5752

RESOLVED - Small percentage of users experiencing problems with fillable PDFs

      • Added 1/25/18
        • Description: A small percentage of users are experiencing an issue in which TaxCaddy is not saving the data they provide in fillable PDFs.
        • Workaround: If you encounter this issue, please notify your tax professional. There are instructions for them to resolve this in their Help Center.
        • Status: This was resolved 07/11/2019.
        • Issue ID: MTH-4163

RESOLVED - Unable to sign documents as a spouse

      • Added 2/20/19
        • Description: Some spouses are unable to sign the documents. This happens when a user and their spouse sign up with TaxCaddy with individual accounts rather than through an invite sent by the spouse. Once the user does add their spouse, it adds them as an additional user instead of Spouse.
        • Workaround: Please contact TaxCaddy Support to manually resolve this issue.
        • Status: This was resolved 04/09/2019.
        • Issue ID: MTH-3299

RESOLVED - New subcategory does not appear automatically

      • Added 3/7/19
        • Description: When uploading a document, you have the option to create a subcategory. Once you add the subcategory, it does not appear automatically.
        • Workaround: Please refresh the page to resolve this issue.
        • Status: This was resolved 04/09/2019.
        • Issue ID: MTHU-4969

RESOLVED - Unable to scroll at certain locations where scrolling is required to see the full list

      • Added 2/6/19
        • Description: Certain panels on the screen would get cut off or not be visible due to a missing scroll bar or an out of reach element on the screen.
        • Workaround: No known workaround yet.
        • Status: This was resolved 01/24/2019.
        • Issue ID: MTHU-4805

RESOLVED - Header and Footer panel not appearing on Document Viewer

      • Added 2/6/19
        • Description: Header and Footer information not appearing for Requested and Uploaded documents.
        • Workaround: No known workaround yet.
        • Status: This was resolved 01/24/2019.
        • Issue ID: MTHU-4805

RESOLVED - Unable to add a document by sharing it with TaxCaddy on mobile if you manage multiple accounts

      • Added 1/29/19
        • Description: If you are a TaxCaddy user who manages multiple accounts, this applies to your account. When opening a document on mobile phones in another application other than TaxCaddy, such as your email, if you share it with TaxCaddy, it won't import.
        • Workaround: Add the document from within TaxCaddy rather than sharing it with TaxCaddy from another document.
        • Related article: Importing saved or downloaded documents on your phone with TaxCaddy
        • Status: This was resolved 01/24/2019.

RESOLVED - Deleting documents via the pick list causes error message

      • Added 5/2/18
        • Description: Deleting a document that was summoned via the pick list will cause an "Oops, something went wrong!" error.
        • Workaround: Despite the error, the document will be deleted successfully. Click on the refresh button to return to TaxCaddy.
        • Status: This was resolved 01/24/2019.

RESOLVED - TaxCaddy occasionally closes when completing the questionnaire

      • Added 11/15/18
        • Affected Product: TaxCaddy
        • Description: TaxCaddy occasionally closes or logs out while the user is completing the questionnaire.
          Workaround: No known workaround yet.
        • Status: This was resolved 01/24/2019.
        • Issue ID: MTH-3892

RESOLVED - Tabbing through fillable PDFs not working as expected

      • Added 3/15/18
        • Description:When viewing a fillable PDF, users can use Tab on their keyboards to move to the next fillable field. However, the order the fields are selected isn't consistent.
        • Workaround: Click in the appropriate field you want to edit.
        • Status: This was resolved 11/26/2018.

RESOLVED - Clicking the Back link in document viewer page exits TaxCaddy when visiting from a direct URL

      • Added 6/15/18
        • Description: The Back link from a document viewer page does not work as expected when visiting the document page directly from a permanent URL (e.g. Bookmark, Copy/Paste). Clicking the link will cause you to exit out of TaxCaddy.
        • Workaround: No known workaround yet.
        • Status: This was resolved 11/26/2018.

RESOLVED - Enabling notifications that were previously disabled does not work as expected

      • Added 6/6/18
        • Description: Enabling notifications that were previously disabled by the user does not work, even though the notifications appear to be enabled.
        • Workaround: No known workaround yet.
        • Status: This was resolved 11/26/2018.

RESOLVED - Using ampersand "&" in a password causes log in error on iOS devices

      • Added 8/20/18
        • Description: Users with an ampersand symbol "&" in their password are unable to log in on an iOS device.
        • Workaround: Log in to TaxCaddy on the web, or reset the password to another password without the "&" symbol.
        • Status: This was resolved 11/15/2018
        • Issue ID: TCM-1368

RESOLVED - Uploading from Google Drive in the Android TaxCaddy app is not working

      • Added 3/2/18
        • Affected Product: TaxCaddy for Android
        • Description: Some users are unable to connect to Google Drive when selecting Upload from Google Drive in the Android TaxCaddy app.
        • Related article: Uploading documents
        • Workaround: Open the document in the Google Drive app and then share it with TaxCaddy. See this article for more information on doing this.
        • Status: This was resolved 6/22/2018

RESOLVED - Issue listing multiple connection requests

      • Added 1/4/18
        • Description: When you receive multiple connection requests from more than one tax professional, you can only see one connection request at a time. You can skip to the next request, but you can't go back without refreshing the page.
        • Workaround: Refresh the page to start at the first request.
        • Status: This was resolved on 3/15/18.

RESOLVED - Users receiving "Document loading error" when opening some documents

      • Added 1/25/18
        • Description: When opening a document, you may see an error message in the PDF viewer with the title WebPDF Viewer and message Document loading error.
        • Workaround: Clear your browser's cache and cookies to resolve this issue. For information on how to clear your cache and cookies, please see the following links to articles provided by the respective software's websites. Please note that these sites are not maintained by the TaxCaddy team. Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Microsoft Edge, and Apple Safari.
        • Status: We have identified and solved the cause of this problem in January 2018; however, if you saw the error before we solved the cause, you will need to perform the workaround above.

RESOLVED - Signing up as a spouse with mobile apps not working as intended

      • Added 2/16/18
        • Description: When signing up as a spouse with the TaxCaddy mobile app, the account will not be created correctly.
        • Workaround: If signing up with TaxCaddy as a spouse, please use a browser on a PC, Mac, or tablet.
        • Related article: Adding and removing additional user accounts.
        • Status: This issue was resolved on 2/19/18.

RESOLVED - Word documents that are converted to PDF can't be opened

      • Added 11/28/17
        • Description: Word documents that are converted to PDFs and added to TaxCaddy can't be opened.
        • Workaround: Native PDFs are working normally.
        • Status: Resolved 1/22/18.

RESOLVED - Connection requests from firms without logos cause the Android mobile app to crash

      • Added 12/4/17
        • Description: When you receive a connection request from a firm that doesn't use a logo in TaxCaddy and you attempt to log in to TaxCaddy with the Android mobile app, the app will crash.
        • Workaround: Please log in to TaxCaddy on the web and respond to the request. Once the request has been accepted, you can use the Android mobile app like normal.
        • Status: Resolved.

RESOLVED - Forgot Password not working in TaxCaddy mobile apps

      • Added 9/28/17
        • Description: During the Forgot Password process in the TaxCaddy mobile apps, TaxCaddy is unable to load security questions. Because of this, the process can't continue.
        • Related article: Resetting your password
        • Workaround: Please use a browser to reset your password rather than the TaxCaddy mobile apps.
        • Status: Resolved 10/6/17.

RESOLVED - TaxCaddy occasionally crashing when opening PDFs in Chrome

      • Added 9/27/17
        • Description: TaxCaddy is occasionally crashing when opening PDFs in Chrome. While Chrome loads a PDF, an error screen will appear that says "Aw, Snap! Something went wrong while displaying this webpage."
        • Workaround: If you see this error, you can try again or use a different browser.
        • Status: Resolved 10/2/17. If you see this issue, please ensure your browser is up-to-date.

RESOLVED - Moving documents fails and causes an error message

      • Added 9/15/17
        • Description: When you attempt to move a document to a different category, the move fails, and you see a screen that says "Oops, something went wrong!"
        • Related articles: Moving documents to other categories.
        • Status: Resolved 9/28/17.

RESOLVED - Push notifications not working on the web

      • Added 9/21/17
        • Description: Push notifications are no longer being sent on the web.
        • Workaround: Email and mobile push notifications are working as normal.
        • Related articles: Updating notification preferences
        • Status: Resolved 9/26/17.

articles.name: Downloading your tax return
articles.title: Downloading your tax return
articles.body:
You can download the tax return to your local device after it has been uploaded by your tax professional. Additionally, you can use the downloaded tax return to print a copy if necessary.

Web

iOS

Android

TaxCaddy.com on PC, Mac, or tablet

Follow these steps to download your tax return using TaxCaddy.com on your PC, Mac, or tablet.

  1. Sign in to TaxCaddy.com

  2. Under Quick access options, click View Tax Returns to see tax returns uploaded for the current tax year.

  3. Alternatively, you can click Tax Returns on the navigation panel.

  4. Select the tax year. Tax returns are only visible under the tax year they were created in by your tax professional.

  5. Click the Menu icon then click Download.

  6. Alternatively, click the tax return you want to view and download.

  7. After your return opens, click the DOWNLOAD button.

    Once the tax return is downloaded on your device, you can open the tax return PDF file and print a copy if necessary.

iOS mobile app

Follow these steps to download your return on the iPhone mobile phone app.

  1. Sign in to the TaxCaddy mobile app.

  2. Tap Tax Return on the tab bar.



  3. Tap the menu icon corresponding to the return you want to download.



  4. Tap Share.



  5. Tap the app with which you want to share the tax return.

Android mobile app

Follow these steps to download your return on the Android mobile phone app.

  1. Sign in to the TaxCaddy mobile app.
  2. Tap the Menu icon



  3. Tap Tax Returns.



  4. Tap the Menu icon corresponding to the return you want to download.



  5. Tap Share.



  6. Tap the app with which you want to share the tax return.

articles.name: Resetting a forgotten password
articles.title: Resetting a forgotten password
articles.body:
If you are having difficulty logging in or resetting your password then please contact TaxCaddy Support team for further assistance.

Click here to learn more about getting help from TaxCaddy Support.

Web

iOS

Android

TaxCaddy.com on PC, Mac, or tablet

Follow these steps to reset your password using TaxCaddy.com on your PC, Mac, or tablet.

  1. Go to taxcaddy.com and click LOG IN.

  2. Click Forgot password?


  3. Type your Email Address and click Send.


  4. TaxCaddy confirms that a link to reset your password was sent to the email address if an account exists for that email. Click the link in the email to reset your password, before it expires in 30 days.

    Resetting a password successfully unlocks an account that has been temporarily locked out due to failed log in attempts.

  5. Open your email with the subject line "Reset your TaxCaddy password" then click Reset Password.

  6. Choose to use either one of your security questions or mobile phone to reset your password (Recommended). Once you have selected your option, click CONTINUE.

    You have a maximum of 3 attempts to reset your password. If you exceed 3 attempts, you will not be able to reset your password. You have to request TaxCaddy Support to reset your password manually.


    If you were logging in using a temporary password (i.e., dynamic password) through a verification code on sent to your phone then select Phone Number to set a permanent password for your account.
    Click here to learn more about logging in with a phone number.

  7. If you choose to use your security question, type the answer to the security question into Answer, and then type a new password into New Password, and type the password again in Confirm Password. Click Reset Password.

    If you choose your mobile phone, provide the verification code that is texted to your confirmed phone number.

  8. Log in to TaxCaddy using the new password.

iOS mobile app

Follow these steps to reset your password using the iPhone mobile phone app.

  1. Start the TaxCaddy mobile app and tap Forgot password.

  2. Provide the email you use with your account then click Send.

  3. Click OK in the confirmation.

  4. Follow the link in the email sent to you to reset your password, before it expires in 30 days. Click Reset Password.

    Resetting a password unlocks an account that has been temporarily locked out due to failed log in attempts.

  5. Tap Security Question or Phone Number to use either one of your security questions or mobile phone to reset your password (Recommended). Tap CONTINUE to proceed.

    You have a maximum of 3 attempts to reset your password. If you exceed 3 attempts, you will not be able to reset your password. You have to request TaxCaddy Support to reset your password manually.

  6. If you selected Security Question then answer your security question, enter a new password, then click RESET PASSWORD.

    If you are unable to answer your security questions, contact Support or email support@taxcaddy.com.

  7. If you selected to verify your account through Phone Number then enter the verification code sent to your mobile phone, enter a new password, then click RESET PASSWORD.

Android mobile app

Follow these steps to reset your password using the Android mobile phone app.

  1. Start the TaxCaddy mobile app then tap Forgot password.

  2. Provide the email you use with your account then click Send.

  3. Follow the link in the email sent to you to reset your password, before it expires in 30 days. Click Reset Password.

    Resetting a password unlocks an account that has been temporarily locked out due to failed log in attempts.

  4. Tap Security Question or Phone Number to use either one of your security questions or mobile phone to reset your password (Recommended). Tap CONTINUE to proceed.

    You have a maximum of 3 attempts to reset your password. If you exceed 3 attempts, you will not be able to reset your password. You have to request TaxCaddy Support to reset your password manually.

  5. If you selected Security Question then answer your security question, enter a new password, then click RESET PASSWORD.

  6. If you selected to verify your account through Phone Number then enter the verification code sent to your mobile phone, enter a new password, then click RESET PASSWORD.

    If you are unable to answer your security questions, contact Support or email support@taxcaddy.com.

articles.name: Navigation bar -- combined this with Overview
articles.title: Navigation bar -- combined this with Overview
articles.body:
Click here to show/hide instructions for iPhone and Android mobile phone app.

iPhone and Android mobile phone app

This article covers the elements on the navigation bar while using the TaxCaddy iPhone or Android mobile phone app.

Tax year

TaxCaddy is set to the current tax year by default, but you can access previous or future tax years by tapping the calendar icon.

Navigation to Overview, Tax Documents, Messages and My Return

The four main screens in TaxCaddy are Overview, Tax Documents, Messages, and My Return. The title of the screen you are currently on appears at the top and has its icon highlighted in green on the navigation bar.

Settings

Settings is where you'll manage your personal information, security measures, additional user accounts, Connections, and more.

TaxCaddy.com on PC, Mac or tablet

This article covers the elements on the navigation bar when using TaxCaddy.com on a PC, Mac or tablet.

CPA Logo and tax year

If your account is connected with your CPA, your CPA's logo appears on the far left of the navigation bar. By default, the tax year is set to the current tax year, but you can access previous or future tax years using the drop-down menu.

Navigation to Overview, Tax Documents, Messages, My Return, and Settings appear on the top bar.

The four main screens in TaxCaddy are Overview, Tax Documents, Messages, and My Return. The screen you are currently on is highlighted in green.

Search

Search results include detailed information about the item. Messages, documents, questionnaire questions, and the return can all be included in results and their type is indicated by an icon.

You can access the Help Center by clicking the icon on the far right of the navigation bar.

User menu and Settings

The user menu provides access to Settings, TaxCaddy Help Center and log out. Settings is where you'll manage your personal information, security measures, and additional user accounts.

articles.name: [INTERNAL] Intro to TaxCaddy:  Overview (DRAFT)
articles.title: [INTERNAL] Intro to TaxCaddy:  Overview (DRAFT)
articles.body:
The Overview screen is where users see a snapshot of their account. This article covers the elements on the Overview screen while using TaxCaddy.com on a computer or tablet.

Progress and Tips

A progress bar at the top of the page illustrates the current phase of the tax preparation process. Below the progress bar, tips are displayed.

Related article: About tax preparation phase

Notifications

Notifications alert users when something in their account needs action, such as connection requests, requested documents, items to review or sign, and the taxpayer questionnaire.

Related article: Understanding notifications

Connection Request Notifications

A very important type of notification is the Connection Request. Users MUST accept the Connection Request before they can send/receive messages or share documents with their CPA. The CPA must initiate the Connection Request, the user cannot initiate it.

Here's what the CPA can do once the user accepts their connection request:

  • Send messages and requests through TaxCaddy
  • See documents uploaded to TaxCaddy by the user or their spouse (additional user)
  • See documents retrieved from financial institutions as authorized by the user
  • Upload documents to the TaxCaddy account for the user

To accept a connection request:

  1. User must sign in to TaxCaddy and be on the Overview screen.
  2. On the New Connection Request notification on the left panel, click View Request.

    An Accept Connection Request dialog box appears.
  3. To accept the connection, click Accept.

    The CPA is connected to the TaxCaddy account.

Related article: Connecting with your CPA

Troubleshooting Connection Requests

If the user is signed in to TaxCaddy but doesn't see a connection request from their CPA:

  • Are you on the Overview screen, looking at the notifications?
    Connection request appears on the Overview screen, on notifications panel (left side of the screen).
  • Did you create your TaxCaddy account using the same email address your CPA sent the invitation to?
    Verify the caller's identity by having them provide the email address where they received the TaxCaddy invitation (or that they use with the CPA), taxpayer's name and name of their CPA. If their information matches our records, contact development team to connect the email address taxpayer is using to sign in to TaxCaddy with the CPA's TaxCaddy account.
    If they created an account without being invited by their CPA, their CPA may not be using TaxCaddy. What then?
  • Do you see your CPA's logo on the far left side navigation bar (next to tax year)? Or, check Activity feed for accepted connection activity.
    If there is a CPA logo or if connection request accepted activity is in activity feed, they are already connected with their CPA. If taxpayer has added spouse to the account, the spouse may have accepted the connection request without taxpayer realizing.

Unread Messages

A panel shows message previews of threads with new unread messages, with a badge indicating the number of unread messages in the thread.

Related article: Seeing unread messages

Tax questionnaire

The CPA issues a questionnaire to gather information they'll need to prepare taxes. Users can toggle between All Questions and Unanswered questions, and a red "NEW" badge indicates that a question is new. Questionnaire progress is updated in real time, and updates are reflected in questionnaire progress notifications as well.

Related article: Filling out the questionnaire

Troubleshooting tax questionnaire

Some potential problems with the questionnaire:

  • Can't find it. Questionnaire appears on Overview screen, left side, on notifications panel.
  • Don't see it on notifications. Taxpayers will not see questionnaire notification until after the CPA issues it. CPA closes questionnaire when they are ready to prepare the return and questionnaire is inaccessible after that (notification disappears).
  • Don't know how to save answers. The questionnaire saves progress automatically. Taxpayer doesn't need to do anything.
  • Got an updated questionnaire. This means CPA has added a question(s) to the questionnaire. New questions have a "New" flag next to their number on the questionnaire. Taxpayer can find them by filtering only unanswered questions (click "Unanswered" button at top of questionnaire).
  • Questionnaire closed and taxpayer needs to change an answer. Questionnaire notification disappears when CPA begins preparing return. Taxpayer will have to contact the CPA and have them reopen the questionnaire. They can do that through the Messages screen.

Document summary and recent uploads

The document summary displays the number of requested items (documents the CPA has requested the taxpayer to sign, review, or upload), the total number of uploaded documents, and the five most recent uploads. Users can also click the upload area or drag documents into the window to upload documents.

Related articles:

  • About document summary
  • Seeing recent uploads

Activity feed

The activity feed keeps track of actions made in the account. Users can click View Full History to see a complete list.

Related article: Seeing activity feed full history

CLICK HERE TO GO TO THE NEXT ARTICLE
Intro to TaxCaddy: Tax Documents

articles.name: Logging in
articles.title: Logging in
articles.body:
This article shows you how to log in to TaxCaddy if you're a returning user.

If you've never logged in to TaxCaddy before, click here to learn about logging in for the first time.

If your attempt to log in failed three times, your account will be locked for two hours.

Web

iOS

Android

TaxCaddy.com on PC, Mac or tablet

Follow these steps to log in to TaxCaddy.com on your PC, Mac or tablet.

  1. Go to taxcaddy.com and click LOG IN.

  2. Type your email address into the top EMAIL field and your password into the bottom PASSWORD field. Then, click SIGN IN.

    You can click the Unmask icon to view your typed password. Similarly, you can click the Mask icon to mask (i.e *****) the password field.

    If you don't remember your password, click the link next to Forgot your password? Click here.

  3. A security code is sent via text to your phone. When TaxCaddy prompts you for a security code, enter the code and then click Verify.

    You can select Don't ask me for verification again on this computer to have TaxCaddy remember this device so you won't be prompted to enter the code when logging in on this device in the future. Two-factor authentication will remain enabled and you will be prompted to enter a code when logging in to TaxCaddy from another device.


    If you don't see the option for Don't ask me again on this computer while logging in with two-factor authentication, your browser may be in private mode or your browser may not support session storage. Update your browser and switch out of private mode to correct this issue, or submit a ticket for further assistance.

  4. You are logged in to TaxCaddy.

    Click here to learn how to connect with your tax professional.

    TaxCaddy logs out automatically if there hasn't been any activity for 20mins.

iOS mobile app

Follow these steps to sign in to TaxCaddy on your iPhone mobile phone app.

  1. Start the TaxCaddy mobile app.

    Click here for help downloading and installing the mobile app.

  2. Type your email address into USERNAME and your password into PASSWORD. Then, tap SIGN IN.

    If you don't remember your password, tap forgot password.

    When logging in, you can click the Mask or Unmask icon to view or hide your typed password.

  3. A security code is sent via text message to your phone. When TaxCaddy prompts you for a security code, enter the code and then tap Submit.

  4. Enable Face ID message will appear for devices with facial recognition enabled.

    Tap Enable to set up facial recognition feature for future logins.

    Tap DON'T ASK ME AGAIN to skip this step. You will not receive any future reminders about enabling Face ID.

    Tap NOT NOW to skip this step. You will receive a reminder next time you log in.

  5. You are now signed in to TaxCaddy.

Android mobile App

Follow these steps to sign in to TaxCaddy on your Android mobile phone app.

  1. Start the TaxCaddy mobile app.

    Click here for help downloading and installing the mobile app.

  2. Type your email address into Username and your password into Password. Then, tap SIGN IN.

    If you don't remember your password, tap forgot password.

    When logging in, you can click the Mask or Unmask icon to view or hide your typed password.

  3. A security code is sent via text message to your phone. When TaxCaddy prompts you for a security code, enter the code and then tap SUBMIT.

  4. If your device supports biometric log in then you can tap Enable to log in without entering a password.

  5. You are signed in to TaxCaddy.

articles.name: Reading and replying to messages
articles.title: Reading and replying to messages
articles.body:
Your correspondence with your tax professional is available on the Messages screen.

Web

iOS

Android

TaxCaddy.com on PC, Mac, or tablet

Follow these steps to read and reply to messages using TaxCaddy.com on your PC, Mac or tablet.

  1. Log in to TaxCaddy.com and click Messages.

  2. Click to select the applicable tax year.

  3. On the Message Threads panel, click the message you want to read or reply to.

    - The red badge  indicates the number of unread messages in the thread.
    - You can click the Add  icon to start a new thread.

  4. The message opens in the center panel. Type your reply and click Send. The number at the bottom indicates the number of characters remaining.

  5. The new message appears below the other messages in the same thread.

iOS mobile app

Follow these steps to read and reply to messages using the iPhone mobile phone app.

  1. Sign in to the TaxCaddy mobile app and tap Messages.

  2. Under Message Threads, tap the message you want to read or reply to.

  3. Type your reply and tap Send. The new message appears below previous messages in the thread.

    The badge indicates the number of unread messages in the thread.

Android mobile app

Follow these steps to read and reply to messages using the Android mobile phone app.

  1. Sign in to the TaxCaddy mobile app. If you have unread messages, tap the messages Tax Pro Request to view your messages. If you don't have unread messages, tap the menu and then Messages.

  2. Under Messages, tap the message you want to read or reply to.

    The badge indicates the number of unread messages in the thread.

  3. You can read your message here.

  4. Tap in Reply to this message to reply. Type your message then click the send button to send your reply.

articles.name: Release Notes 2019-11-05, Web 3.10 (Previous Tax Year, Design Updates)
articles.title: Release Notes 2019-11-05, Web 3.10 (Previous Tax Year, Design Updates)
articles.body:
Hello! Here's what's new in TaxCaddy!

Previous tax years

When viewing a previous tax year(s), you may now see a banner notification displaying YOUR TAX PROFESSIONAL NO LONGER HAS ACCESS TO TAX YEAR [Tax Year]. Once a previous tax year(s) has passed a certain time period limit, tax professionals can no longer access documents, messages, or any other information from that tax year.

Click here to learn more about viewing different tax years.

Design Updates

Changes to the UI were made to improve the user experience. The following features have been redesigned with an updated look:

Settings

Tabs on the Account Settings screen will now show a left panel for improved user experience.

Click here to learn more about Account Settings.

Click here to learn more about Account Security

Change Number

The Two Factor - Change Number dialog box has been redesigned with an updated UI.

Click here to learn more about updating your phone number.

Payment Accounts

The Payment Accounts tab has been redesigned with an updated UI.

Done Uploading

The Done Uploading dialog box has been redesigned with an updated UI.
